A power screed or laser screed is used to level and finish freshly laid concrete before it dries, and offers an automated alternative to the screed bar that required manual pulling. There are different variants of concrete screeds for sale, including manual and laser guided screeds.

Uses of Concrete Screeds

Manual floor screeders are essentially a straight piece of metal. They are dragged or pulled across the concrete surface in order to flatten, smooth, and compact the concrete. While this type of manual device may prove perfectly adequate for a small patch of concrete and a home DIY project, larger projects usually utilise a machine that does not require as much manual operation, that can compact more efficiently, and that will create a smoother and flatter surface finish. An automated concrete floor screed will do a better job, more efficiently, and more quickly than a manual screed board.

Vibrating Power Screed

The most common form of automated power screed for sale is that of the vibrating screed. This type of model has a motor and a screed blade, and the motor effectively vibrates the blade, which removes excess concrete and material to leave a smooth, flat finish. These concrete screeders typically require manual operation but they do ensure a better quality finish. However, a frame system can be used to further improve the efficiency of the machine.

Screed Rails

Concrete screed rails can be used to construct a guide frame around the concrete to the desired level. When a vibrating screeder is then pulled over the surface, this helps to ensure that the concrete is perfectly level and flat. This type of system also allows for the use of mechanical screeders, potentially reducing the amount of manual work and the time taken to complete the project.

Laser Screed for Sale

A concrete laser screed is usually attached to a large vehicle and has an extending boom. The blades vibrate in order to loosen and remove the excess material, while laser sensors are used to ensure an extremely precise level and finish. Simple and Effective Plasma Cutting Machines

A plasma cutter uses inert gas, through which an electric current is passed, creating plasma from some of the gas. This plasma is hot enough and moves quickly enough that it will not only cut metal but it will also blow the molten metal away. Used in any application where metals need to be cut quickly and efficiently, plasma cutters are available in a number of different forms and styles.

Using Plasma Cutters

Using a plasma cutter is a very simple process, and arguably the most difficult aspect is choosing the most appropriate plasma cutter machine for your requirements. There are many makes and models currently on the market, and when used plasma cutters are also considered, this further expands the selections that are available to the buyer. The simplicity of operation, and the length of time that manufacturers have had to create inexpensive plasma cutting machines, means that a DIY plasma cutter is also a viable option – especially because of the number of portable models that can be easily stored until they are needed again. Safety is important, however, because of the incredible heats that the arc nozzle will reach.

Plasma Cutter Mobility

Mobility is one of the advantages of a plasma cutting machine compared to other industrial cutting machines. An air plasma cutting machine is typically a lot lighter than an oxyacetylene cutter, and it can be moved around the workshop, or even from one location to another with relative ease. However, some models and some types of plasma cutter are more portable than others, and you should consider whether you will need to regularly move the cutter when it is in use. This will help you to determine which is the best used plasma cutter for your needs, but it is only one consideration when looking at used plasma cutters for sale.

Duty Cycle of CNC Plasma Cutter

The duty cycle is essentially the number of hours that the plasma CNC machine will be used without rest. In some instances, and most commonly with a CNC plasma cutter, the cutter will be on operation for longer periods of time, and this will affect the appropriate model to buy. CNC plasma cutters that are used infrequently can be purchased so that they are just capable of cutting the thickest material that needs cutting, but if the CNC plasma cutting machine, or manual cutting machine is required for longer periods of time, then it will need to offer more power output.

Computer Numerical Control (CNC) means that the cutting process can be largely automated, and it is possible to ensure a precise cut as well as being able to easily change the shape, depth, and other details of the cut achieved. A CNC plasma cutter for sale will typically prove more expensive than a manual machine, but if you have the machinery and equipment, then choosing a used CNC plasma cutter can help keep costs of purchase down compared to buying new, while also potentially helping to reduce costs and workload in the future. As when buying any equipment, you should ensure that you buy a used plasma cutter that is still in good condition, and that offers the features, power requirements, and other requirements that are necessary for you.

Notching machine has the ability to cut, shear or punch a range of metal products.

They are commonly used in the construction machinery and manufacturing industries as a low cost way to notch metals in order to create tools, bike frames and accessories. Almost all types of metal have the ability to be notched, even hard and awkward metals including stainless steels, titanium and heat treated alloys. Notching is also used as a precursor to further manufacturing processes such as metal bending and joinery.

Notching Machine Structure

Notching machine is typically large and sturdy and have a vice system to securely hold the metal in place and prevent it from slipping. A hydraulic notching machine is extremely powerful and is able to cut through all types of metal with ease. There are a range of pipe notching machines available to purchase including a sheet metal corner notcher, pipe notching machine and notch and bend machines.

Types of sheet metal notcher

There are three main types of notching: end notching, tube notching and side notching. End notching is where the end of the tub is notched in order for it to make a base of a tee. End notching is often used in the bicycle manufacturing process. A tubing notcher is most commonly used to notch several tubes in order to smoothly join them together. Side notching, also referred to as offset notching, is where the side of a tube is notched for bending or for use in a tee joint.

Polishing Machinery Makes Smooth Surfaces

There are many use cases where something may need polishing up, but this kind of machinery tends to come in the form of metal polishers due to the fact that metal is the main material that is likely to need polishing, and other materials (such as plastic) need a more delicate touch. A metal polisher machine can be used to restore a sparkling shine to a tarnished ornament or chrome trimming, or simply clean up some industrial component that has become grimy through use. A particularly useful application for this kind of equipment is in the polishing of hydraulic components, where a gentle touch is needed to prevent the equipment from being rendered inoperable by the cleaning process.

Metal Polishing Equipment

Metal polishing Machinery tend to come in a variety of form factors to suit different situations. Polishers intended for heavy duty use will typically be free standing, often requiring fixing to the floor to prevent excessive movement. A polisher machine intended for lighter use may come in the form of a simple bench-mounted wheel. Metal polishers can also be portable. Both electric and air powered tools capable of housing a polishing abrasive wheel are regularly used in situations where it is not possible or even practical to take the item that needs polishing to fixed polishing equipment.

Safety Issues when Polishing Metal

The History of Tig Welding

The concept of the type of welding in an inert gas atmosphere was first developed in the late 19th century, but the welding of non-ferrous metals such as aluminum remained a problem, as these tend to react with the atmosphere, resulting in poor quality welds. Beginning in the 1930s, inert gases supplied in bottles were used to protect the weld area from contamination, but it was in the aircraft industry that the process was perfected when Russel Meredith created his Heliarc method. This utilised a tungsten electrode arc and helium as a shielding gas, therefore giving rise to the name of tungsten inert gas welding. Today, a tig welding machine is most often used to weld thin stainless steel sections, as well as non-ferrous metals such as copper alloys, magnesium and aluminum. Using a tig welder for aluminum is commonplace in many industries. Nowadays, intelligent welding robots are utilized for TIG/MIG welding of parts.

The Use of the Heat Source in Tig Welding

The tig welding machine process requires three distinctive elements. These are heat, shielding and a filler metal. Heat is produced by a thermal arc tig welder, reaching a temperature of at least 5,000 degrees centigrade, when electricity passes through the tungsten electrode and arcs to the metal. To create this arc a high-frequency generator produces an electric spark forming a conductive path through the shielding gas between the electrode and the workpiece; a distance generally of 1.5 to 3 mm. Once the arc has been established the welding torch is moved slightly in a rotating motion to form a weld pool. While being careful to maintain an ongoing separation between the metal being worked on and the electrode, the welder tilts the torch slightly from vertical so that tig welding wire can be added to the leading edge of the weld pool as required. It requires the use of both hands as the welder manually feeds filler metal into the area being worked on while simultaneously wielding the welding torch. While using tig welders, operators tend to develop a technique whereby they rapidly alternate between adding filler metal and advancing the torch. Tungsten is used for the torch electrode due to its very high melting point; it is not consumed during the welding process. 

Filler Metals and Shielding Gases Used with a Tig Welder

Filler metals are used in most tig welding applications, although not always in the welding of some thin materials. They are available in different diameters and are made of different materials. Tig welding gas is used as a shield during the process to protect the welding area from gases such as nitrogen and oxygen in the atmosphere as these can cause weld defects such as porosity, brittleness and fusion problems if they make contact with the weld pool, arc or electrode. A shielding gas also serves other functions during the tig welding process as it transfers heat from the tig welding wire to the metal and assists in creating a stable arc. Argon is the most commonly used shielding gas as, when used with alternating current, it results in a high weld quality that also looks good. Helium is also commonly used, along with argon-helium mixtures. An inverter tig welder power source can be used for a big tig welder.

Arc welding is one of a number of fusion processes used in the joining of metals. An arc welding machine uses the intense heat produced by an electric arc to melt two pieces of metal so that they intermix and form a metallurgical bond

The Principles and Uses of Arc Welding Machines

An electric arc welder creates an electrical arc between an energized circuit feeding a wire electrode and the metal that is being worked on. The arc is produced when the tip of the electrode touches the metal. The electrode is withdrawn, yet still remains in close proximity to the metal and an arc is formed between the two which can produce a temperature of around 3,600 degrees Celsius. The heat from arc welding machine melts the base metal, producing a molten pool which solidifies behind the electrode as it travels along the joint, resulting in a fusion bond. The two pieces of metal may be melted to intermix directly or, more commonly, a filler metal is used. Arc welding machine's electrodes can be a rod or wire that simply conducts the current and is not consumed, or it can melt and itself supply the filler metal to the joint. The latter welding method is most common in the manufacturing of steel products. Metal arc welding results in contamination as metals at high temperatures react chemically with certain elements in the air, and so a shielding gas is used to minimize air/molten metal contact. Gas metal arc welding, commonly called MIG Welder, uses a continuous-feed consumable wire which acts as both electrode and filler metal. With a submerged arc welding machine, the arc is created beneath a layer of flux to protect the weld from contamination. Gas tungsten arc welding, commonly called TIG, uses a non-consumable electrode made of tungsten and the filler metal is fed in separately. It's worth bearing in mind when searching for arc welding equipment that there are a number of other arc welding methods include carbon arc, shielded metal arc, atomic hydrogen, flux-cored arc, stud arc and electro-gas. An inverter arc welder will allow you a certain amount of versatility.

Modern winding machines are the grandchildren of the device that helped bear the fruits of the Industrial Revolution. They can be found in all sorts of industries, using an automated spinning motion and a variety of technological improvements to wind materials up for packaging and shipping.

What Is a Winding Machine?

If you've ever wondered how thread, string and coil all end up nicely coiled and wrapped around a central bobbin, the answer is no longer some poor soul doing it all by hand. Simply put, the ceiling fan winding machine takes the hard work out of winding any long, thin object by spinning itself round and pulling the material in loops to make it easier to package and ship.

Industrial Uses of A Winding Machine

Winding machines can be found in many different industries and can be put to use anywhere that produces long lengths of their product that need to be stored in a compact manner. The most common types of industry using winding machines include rope, cinematic film, textiles and paper. Many electronic industries also use a coil winding machine to make it easier for their workers to use and cut the right lengths whilst they're out on the job.

How Does a Coil Winding Machine Work?

The hardest part of using a coil winding machine is getting the whole process started. Each machine will vary in how easy it is to feed the material in, but most will have a central lock at one end of the spindle. This allows the first inch or two to be fed in and clamped into place. At that point, the machinery takes over, rotating continuously at a set speed which pulls the material on. Most manufacturers feed their chosen material on at an angle to help the winding machine create an equal diamater as it goes along. This accounts for the wavy patterns you'll see on rolls of yarn or twine as well as explaining how they come out in such uniform widths.

The Key Features of a Winding Machine

Whilst there are many different types of winding machine, they all have some common features in the way that they operate:

• A central spindle - Whilst the width of the bobbin will vary depending on the expected final load of the product, eachcoil winding machine will have a central spindle that is powered by electricity to create the spin. A circular spindle is used when speed is of the essence, usually in industries like textiles or paper where volume accounts for many sales, whilst a square bar provides more torque, making it the preferred shape for heavy metals and rope.

• Edge sensors - In most situations, the mechanisation of the winding machines means that they are left to get on with the job once the initial feeding has been done. This means that edge sensors are essential technology as they can switch the machine off as soon as the desired diameter has been reached. They can also be used to spot any problems in the winding, such as uneven knotting or a build up in one particular part of the roll.

• Speed limits - Recent years have seen a big increase in the amount of technology used on motor winding machine, in particular coil winding machines. The biggest development is variable speed limits, which allow the user to change the speed of rotation depending on what product is being wound. Coil winding machines have benefitted greatly from a variation of speed as they are the most susceptible to problems due to overheating and friction from the wire.

A wire drawing machine is used to pull wire through dies to reduce its cross section. Wires produced from wire drawing machinery are used for a range of applications; a copper wire drawing machine, for example, can draw out the thin, conductive copper wire required for electrical wiring.

Drawing Machine Setup

Air Compressor

For the hobbyist, or home user, the best air compressor will be small and portable air compressor, and may be referred to as a consumer-grade small air compressor. This is more than capable of inflating consumer goods and car tires, and portable air compressors can also be used to power and run a good variety of low-energy tools, such as staplers. However, the portable compressor will not typically have adequate power for multiple tools or for use with larger and more energy intensive tools. It is possible to find a good quality and cheap air compressor for sale to keep in the garage for occasional use, but more frequent use will require a better equipped model.

Portable Small Construction Compressors

There are portable small air compressors for sale that are ideal for use by contractors and those that regularly work on building sites and in other locations. These portable models do offer more power than the consumer models, and they are built to withstand the rough treatment that portable small compressors might receive while at locations like a building site. They have to be portable, because they will not only need to be moved from job to job, but may also need to be moved around the site, too.

Industrial Air Compressors

For the biggest and most powerful industrial air compressor models are those that offer the greatest flexibility and the widest range of use. These machines are found in auto body shops, as well as in industrial warehouses and factories. Industrial air compressors are commonly fixed, or too large to be regularly moved, and they are typically not used by contractors, because they are too cumbersome, or by home users because of the high cost of most industrial air compressors for sale.

Compressor Components

All models and sizes, whether a small air compressor or an air compressor industrial, use an engine, a storage cylinder, and a gauge. The gauge measures the pressure of the air inside the cylinder, where it is stored after the engine, which may be petrol or electric, has forced it into the tank. All parts may wear out eventually, but it is possible to replace engines and gauges, as well as finding air compressor tanks for sale. The tank must remain air-tight and no air must be allowed to leak, otherwise this compromises the level of air pressure, and renders the machine useless. When looking for a used air compressor for sale, which can provide an affordable and convenient means of buying a potentially vital but expensive piece of workshop machinery, it is important to check the overall condition of the parts including the tank.

Power Sources

Although most compressors for sale operate from the mains, some gas or diesel models are portable enough that they can be kept in the trunk of the car. This offers a simple and effective way to inflate tires, even at the side of the road. For the mobile mechanic, this type of portable air compressor offers similar benefits, and there are a number of used air compressors for sale that have been designed with portability as well as power in mind. It is important that the buyer considers their power source, as well as other factors, because if they do not have the appropriate power source, then the air compressor will not work efficiently. Portable compressors should typically work on gasoline, because of the lack of availability of an electricity source, but gasoline powered compressors should only be used in ventilated areas in order to ensure the safety of the user.

Matching Compressor To Requirements

One factor that every buyer should consider before investing in used air compressors, is that the performance rating of the tools they will be using. The buyer should thus match the power of the air compressor to the power requirements of their tools, otherwise the tools will be inefficient or not work at all.

Hand Carts and Portability of a Air Compressor

When buying a used air compressor, it is worth noting that some will include a hand cart because while it may be possible to move them by hand, they can still be very heavy and the assistance of the hand cart can prove invaluable. For most commercial buyers, the size of the tank and the horsepower of the air compressor for sale will prove more important than the cost of buying, and most commercial operations will be able to provide the level and type of power that the compressor needs. Quality, durability, and power should all be considered important factors for air compressor sales.

Concrete Mixers and Cement Mixers

A concrete mixer, also known as a cement mixer, uses a revolving drum to mix cement with water and an aggregate material such as gravel or sand. This is one of the essential machines in road construction equipment and building construction materials. Concrete mixers can be large and truck-mounted or small and portable.

The Types Of Concrete Mixers

The first concrete mixing machine was invented in 1905 by the industrialist Gebhardt Jaeger, but since then different types of both stationary and mobile mixers have evolved to address the considerable worldwide demand for consistent mixes. However, three types of concrete mixers are predominant in today's industrial world.

The type of concrete mixer machine with the lowest maintenance and operating costs is the drum mixer, used for larger volumes. The high production speed of this kind of mixer makes it a market leader in the ready-mixed arena as it helps to drive down costs. Twin shaft mixers are generally used for high strength cement production and offer short mixing times.

Vertical axis mixers are predominantly used for pre-stressed and precast concrete, and because they can be efficiently and relatively easily cleaned between batches they are excellent for coloured concrete. The vertical axis concrete pan mixer is gradually being supplanted by the planetary, otherwise known as counter-current, mixer, so that the former can now often be found for a reasonable price on the used cement mixer market.

In-transit concrete mixers, invented by Stephen Stepanian in the early 20th century, have been adopted worldwide as a means of transporting and mixing cement and delivering it to construction sites.

These are very efficient as the mixing can be performed during transport on the back of the truck. Alternatively, a volumetric concrete mixer can be used. These are trucks containing the necessary ingredients to be mixed as and when required. Concrete pumps can be used to take the concrete to where it is required if the truck cannot get close enough. However, it is often the case that large amounts of cement are not required, in which case it is more cost-effective to use one of the many models of portable concrete mixer that are available. These typically use a small revolving drum into which the component materials are placed for the mixing process. Such a mobile concrete mixer may be powered by petrol engines, or an electric concrete mixer might be used.

Concrete pumps provide the means for transferring liquid concrete to the precise location where it is required. Connected to a flexible hose which can be extended for some distance, it allows the concrete to be moved to difficult locations such as multi storey buildings.

The Types Of Concrete Pumps

Liquid concrete can often be tipped out of a concrete mixer straight to where it is required, but often the desired location is inaccessible by means of this method, and the concrete requires assistance to get where it needs to be. This is where concrete pumps come in. However, concrete presents many challenges to pump manufacturers and can place a great strain on concrete pumping equipment. It has a tendency to solidify if it is not kept agitated. It is also abrasive, generally contains some very hard pieces of rock, and is both heavy, thick and sticky. Piston pumps are generally used to keep this difficult substance in motion, as they can exert a great deal of pressure in pushing cylinders of concrete mixes. One type of concrete pump is the trailer concrete pump. This uses an articulating robot arm boom which is operated by remote control for accurate placement. Such boom concrete pumps are capable of dealing with high volumes. The other major type of concrete pump is known as a truck-mounted concrete pump, or line pump. With this type, linked hoses are manually attached to the machine's outlet and placed where they need to be. This is a slightly more labour intensive method that is generally used for smaller volumes. A skid mounted small concrete pump can also be used in places of particularly limited access, such as mines. When looking for used concrete pumps it's advisable to determine your exact requirements before purchasing. You need to consider what kind of portable concrete pump would be most suitable for your business, taking into account such factors as horizontal and vertical boom reach, pumping rate, concrete pressure, cylinder length and diameter and the number of outrigger legs.

Directional drilling equipment is essential in the gas and oil industry and has been since the early twentieth century, remaining more or less the same (conceptually) in the intervening years.

What is Directional Drilling?

As the name suggests, directional drilling allows drilling for things like oil and gas at various angles, rather than just vertical (straight down), which greatly increases the efficiency and return of a drilling operation. It also allows for a cheaper operation, as many formations can be reached from one drilling platform, unlike with vertical drilling where a drill would have to be placed directly over the formation. This technology allows for reservoirs to be tapped by a single drilling location, even if that location is miles away from the reservoir itself. Horizontal directional drilling equipment allows for the drilling of wells at up to eighty degree angles. Using a horizontal directional drilling machine can also allow for the drilling of wells or holes under obstacles, such as bodies of water. Horizontal drilling can also be used to pull a medium (such as piping) through the hole it has drilled.

You can generally find a directional drill for sale to suit any need, whether you need a small directional drilling machine suitable for things like running pipe under a home, or a large scale machine to bore down under a lake. A gas air compressor is used to pressurise a variety of gasses in order to either increase flow through a medium or condense its volume for a production or transportation purpose. Gas compressors are a type of compressors.

Uses and Techniques of Gas Compressors

A gas compressor reduces the volume of gas and thus compresses it, increasing the pressurisation of the material. Very much like a pump, the gas is forced through a moving mechanism, increasing the velocity of the gas and increasing the pressure through the use of a diffuser. There are various mechanical versions of the gas compressor, which operate in slightly different ways for different applications, a natural gas compressor is an example of this. The following are some of the different techniques used in mechanical gas compressors:

  • Centrifugal compressors
  • Diagonal or mixed-flow compressors
  • Axial-flow compressors
  • Reciprocating compressors
  • Rotary screw compressors
  • Rotary vane compressors
  • Scroll compressors
  • Diaphragm compressors
  • Air bubble compressor

All with different uses, it is important you understand fully about what you need from your gas compressors.

Where to Buy Gas Compressors?

There is a large selection of gas compressors on the market, with differing functions and purposes all being catered for. It is important to understand your specific requirements and acquire a machine that will do what you need when looking for gas air compressors for sale or even a regular used compressor for sale.

A turbo air compressor features a turbine and a compressor that are connected by a shaft. The energy for the turbo core compressor is supplied by a exhaust gas driven turbine.

Turbo Compressor Design and Function

The air compressor turbo consists of three essential components to make it function. These components are a diffuser, a compressor wheel and housing. Air is drawn into the compressor axially with the rotational speed of the wheel and is then accelerated to a high velocity before being expelled in the radial direction. The function of the diffuser is to slow the speed of the high velocity air so that both the temperature and pressure increase. The diffuser is created by the backplate of the used compressor and part of the volute housing. This in turn collects the air and further reduces the speed before the air reaches the exit of the turbo compressor.

The Operating Characteristics of Turbo Compressors

The operating behaviour of the oil turbo compressor is defined by special maps that show the relationship between the pressure ratio and the mass or volume flow rate. The section of the map that cannot be used relates to centrifugal compressors and is limited to the choke and surge lines as well as the maximum possible compressor speed. All of these are factors one must consider when looking for construction machinery for sale such as used turbo compressors.

Leading turbo compressor manufacturers include MAN, POWERSTROKE, WICKED WHEEL, GARRETT, TOYOTA and FORD.

A baling press is a piece of plant which compresses material into regular rectangular prisms or cubes. This enables the material to be easily transported and stored, minimising the amount of work required to move materials from one place to another. A bale press machine consists of an engine, a hopper (or container) to contain the material and a hydraulic arm which squeezes the material either horizontally or vertically to achieve a more regular shape.

Different types of baling presses

The material requiring compression frequently determines the type of hydraulic baling press which is most appropriate. A scrap baling press, for example, will be used to crush waste metal, textiles, card, paper or other materials which are commonly recycled. A hydraulic bale press machine may also be a scrap baler or used to shape hay bales or other agricultural products. A number of different sizes are available, as well as hydraulic arms which offer varying levels of pressure. Balers may be portable and also optimised to produce bales which are optimised for subsequent HGV transport.

Major hydraulic bale press machine manufacturers

HSM is a British manufacturer who produces a wide selection of bale press machines, including mobile models, energy efficient machines and those suitable for baling dense, heavy items. APOLLO has an international presence and specialises in baling press products which can either stand alone or form part of an entire system. A hydraulic baling press machine from APOLLO is particularly suitable for use in manufacturing or in a recycling plant, where an integrated system is required to successfully process large volumes of materials.

Air handlers - prices, manufacturers & auctions

Air handler (also known as air handling unit, or shorter AHU) is a system responsible for circulating and ventilating air. There are different types of air handlers. Terminal units are small air handlers designed for local use. Packaged units (also rooftop units) are bigger and used outdoors. 

An air handling unit consists of many parts. Filters are responsible for providing clean air. Humidifier prevents the air from being too dry, when the blower’s task is to move the air at a certain flow rate. 

What is the difference between an air conditioner and air handler?

Air handlers are machines distributing conditioned air throughout a room, when air conditioners remove the heat from indoor air and carry it outside. Unlike air handling units, air conditioner is located outside a building. 

How much is an air handler?

Air handlers’ prices range from $500 to $3,500. Remember about installation costs on top of that. If you are looking for a cost effective solution, have a look at the second market. Air handlers are durable machines, which last up to 20 years. Buying a used air handler will deliver you great performance for a much lower cost.

Feeding equipment are farm machines which are used in the agricultural industry in the course of animal husbandry. Feed trailers, feed mixers, silage cutters, creep feeders, grinding and mixing equipment, moisture counters and scales are items that belong to farm and cattle feed equipment.

Feeding Equipment And Its Manufacturers

There are two basic types of animal feed, fodder and forage. Forage consists of plant stems consumed by grazing livestock. Fodder refers to the food that is specifically given to the animals such as calf feeding equipment or sheep feeding equipment, rather than that which they forage for themselves. This includes straw, silage, hay, sprouted grains and legumes, pelleted feeds and other mixed rations. To help with the distribution of fodder, there is a wide range of farm and livestock feeding equipment available from noted manufacturers, many of which boast decades of experience and expertise. The KVERNELAND Taarup 600 series of diet feeders has an excellent reputation in the agricultural industry. It has a two contra-rotation auger system and a highly accurate weighing system that results in a quality, homogeneous feed material. It is especially designed to incorporate all feed formats into the ration without any pre-chopping requirement. The WATSON feeding trailer is a very popular item of equipment that is in demand on the used feeding equipment market. It is capable of feeding thirty to forty cattle and has an all steel construction throughout. Silage making in agricultural industries like farms involves cutting grass into swathes, using a silage cutter, and leaving it to wilt; a silage chopper then chops and blows the forage into a trailer which transports it to where it is baled and eventually opened using a silage block or bale cutter. 

How does a Silage Cutter work?

The silage machine is attached to a tractor and the trailer to a separate tractor. After being picked up from the swathe the grass is chopped into 7cm lengths by knives on the rotor and chopper. It is then blown through the chute into a trailer by hydraulic control.

A hay rake is a tool used in agriculture to collect cut hay or straw. It is generally used to order the hay into what is known as "windrows" so that it can be collected later, such as by loader wagon, or a baler.

Hay Rake Types

There are many types of hay rake to suit different needs. A wooden hay rake, for example, is a handheld version (similar to a typical household brush) that is only really suitable for small areas. Moving up in scale, a small hay rake can be pushed by hand, or even towed by a modest vehicle. A rotary hay rake on the other hand will tend to be for much larger operations covering entire fields and will require a tractor to operate. Regardless of the type, the functionality is much the same; the hay rake teeth (also known as hay rake tines) push the hay around to the desired arrangement (the aforementioned windrows, usually). The difference being how much the user has to do, for example pushing an old hay rake around by hand as opposed to simply driving a wheel hay rake around and letting it take care of everything.

Mowers And The Top Manufacturers

The first mower was invented by an Englishman, Edwin Budding, in 1827, but it wasn't until the 1860s that lawn mower manufacture took off. There is now a tremendous variety available, and if you are looking to buy a mower it's best to spend some time thinking about the type most suitable to your needs. Cylinder mowers are available in electric or hand push versions. Hover mowers are lightweight and easy to manoeuvre and so ideal for uneven surfaces and slopes. Wheeled, electric rotary mowers might be the best option for the average family lawn. Larger areas are best tackled with petrol mowers, which can be self-propelling, or ride on models. Robotic mowers can be left to get on with the job with little supervision. When it comes to the top manufacturers, the HAYTER brand is synonymous with professional standard grass cutting and has been for over fifty years. MOUNTFIELD is renowned for the quality and reliability of their mowers. The JOHN DEERE mowers are also highly regarded. BRIGGS & STRATTON are the leading manufacturer stateside. Balers for Sale

Balers are part of hay equipment in agricultural machinery that are used for the compression of a harvested crop, forming it into compact bales that can be handled, transported and stored with comparative ease. Crops such as cut straw, hay or silage can be dealt with in this way. Bales produced by hay balers may be square/rectangular or round/cylindrical and of various sizes, and can be bound in a variety of ways. Balers might use straps, twine, wire or even netting to maintain the bale in its proper shape. There are numerous makes of balers for sale, so the buyer has to decide which is the most suitable for their purposes. However, new models can prove costly, so it's worth giving some thought to acquiring a hay baler for sale. Balers, by the very nature of the task they are required to perform, are strong pieces of machinery, and tend to be sold on only when the previous owner requires an upgrade. Therefore you can look through the selection of used balers for sale with confidence, knowing that you'll be acquiring a robust item of farm machinery that will give you years of good service. Buying used balers is a great way to save money and the best place to look for hay balers for sale at online used farm equipment auctions. Here you will be able to choose from a wide and reasonably priced selection of used balers for sale, and with so many options the chances of finding a used baler for sale are greatly increased. 

  • Round Balers

The most common types of balers used in industrialised farming today are round balers. These produce cylindrical bales which are particularly effective at withstanding inclement weather as they tend to shed water. Depending on the size and material of the bale and its moisture content, round balers for sale can weigh from 500 to 1,000 kg and have dimensions of up to 180 cm in diameter and 150 cm in width. Used round balers for sale often come on to the market and can be purchased for a fraction of the price of new equipment. 

  • Square Balers

Another commonly used baler is a square baler. These produce bales that are generally more highly compacted than round bales, and are easier to stack and transport, and also take up less space in storage. There are square balers available that produce smaller bales, capable of being handled manually, but these are predominantly found on small acreage farms. Many square balers are designed to follow directly behind the tractor in the same way as round balers. A surprising number of older used square balers for sale find their way on to the used farm machinery auction market and despite their age may be in excellent condition. Such auctions allow for an excellent overview of what's available, so that you can track down a baler bargain.

Several top manufacturers offer a variety of models like Vermeer and McHale. Some create round bales of hay, grass or wheat. Others like the Band-it machine use a square design. Bale wrappers are available as mounted or trailed versions. The machine is pulled behind a truck like the Kuhn models and the hay wraps around into a round bale.

A hay tedder is an item of machinery which uses rotating forks to aerate loose hay and speed up the haymaking process.

Hay Tedder Operation, Uses and Benefits

Hay tedders wuffle the cut hay which in turn quickens the drying process and allows the hay to cure faster, which results in a better colour and aroma of hay. Originally, hay tedders where pulled by horses or oxens, but in modern times the larger tedders are often attached onto a large vehicle such as a tractor to more efficiently aerate larger quantities hay. The machine features several wheels which are positioned onto a rotation axle which allows it to be pulled through a field easily. They are commonly used in a range of agricultural industries to save both labour and money in the haymaking process.

What do Manure Spreaders do?

Manure Spreaders are machines used for agriculture and farming that distribute fertilizers (manure) across crops or fields. They are also known by the nicknames ‘muck spreader’ or ‘honey wagon’. The first successful automated manure spreader was designed in 1875 by Joseph Kemp.

What are the different types of Manure Spreaders?

 

Manure spreaders can be grouped into three specific types:

  • Box spreaders.
    Box spreaders are used to transport and spread material that has a high enough bedding content to allow it to be heaped.
  • Flail spreaders.
    Flail Spreaders are most effective when used in conjunction with semi-solid material. These require more power to operate than box spreaders.
  • Liquid manure spreaders.
    Liquid manure spreaders, also known as closed tank spreaders, is used for the spreading of liquid manure, which is released using gravity, air pressure or pumps.

The Role of Used Forwarders in Your Business

The forestry forwarder, unlike the skidder which drags the logs, picks the logs up clear of the ground in order to move them, and forestry forwarders can vary from the smaller designs that are meant to be towed behind an all-terrain vehicle to much larger, self-contained units. When looking for a used forwarders for sale, it is important that you choose the appropriate wood forwarder machine, and most log forwarders for sale are classified by the load that they can carry. Used forwarders are thus part of forestry equipment.

Restricted or Protected Access

Forestry forwarders are not able to carry the same kind of load as skidders, but they do limit damage to the soil. If access is restricted, felling is being performed on a selection of trees rather than a whole forest, or if conservation is vital, then choosing a high quality logging forwarder for sale, rather than a skidder, is the preferred option.

Models and Limits of Forestry Forwarders

Small forwarders for sale will typically cope with loads of up to half a tonne, whereas logging forwarders designed to be towed by tractors can carry as much as 4 tonnes. Small purpose-built machines will manage up to 8 tonnes, medium machines up to 12 tonnes and a large, heavy-duty forwarder can carry as much as 20 tonnes of load. These differences make it vital that you choose the most appropriate log forwarder for sale – placing too much load on the forwarder forestry may lead to damage to the logging equipment, and it could pose a hazard to those operating it.

Choosing a Used Forestry Forwarder

Stump Grinder Types & Uses

When a tree has been felled, the removal of the remaining stump can often prove to be quite problematic. A powered tree stump grinder is the best and most effective option. The most commonly used type of stump grinder is fitted with a wheel set with fixed carbide teeth. This rotates rapidly and reduces the stump wood to small chips. Hydraulic cylinders are used to raise and lower the cutting wheel and move it laterally across the surface of the stump, grinding it down to the desired level. A tree grinder or stump grinder can be as small as a lawn mower or as large as a car or van. Some are designed as attachments that can be fitted to tractors or excavators. Small jobs can be tackled with a 13 or 14 hp model that is light and maneuverable. Larger models, such as those used in the forestry sector, are often self-propelled and may have a diesel engine. These are controlled either by a manual control panel or may it be radio controlled so that the operator can stand at a safe distance. Some stump grinders are fitted with removable grinding teeth which can be replaced without the necessity of changing the wheel.

The Range of Sweeping Machines

A road sweeper has to contend with a range of different roads surfaces, road conditions, and types of dirt and debris. The sweeper truck itself must be able to cope with tight cornering, and while larger street sweepers for sale are well-suited to collecting large volumes of trash without having to stop and unload, they can prove too cumbersome and bulky for some applications. In these circumstances, a smaller, electric sweeper may be better suited to the task at hand, while choosing the most appropriate sweeper technology will help ensure the best dirt collection results.

Types of Street Sweepers

  •  Mechanical

The traditional floor sweeper uses a mechanical broom to literally sweep dirt and debris onto a conveyor and into a storage tank. This type of sweeper machine may struggle over bumpy, rough, or poorly maintained road surfaces, but is usually the least expensive to purchase and can prove effective for short runs over car parks and smooth, flat surfaces. However, these road sweepers in action do tend to miss smaller dust particles so may leave the area dusty, and will not usually prove suitable for sandy or dirty areas.

  • Regenerative

A regenerative street sweeper truck uses a continuous flow of air that initially blasts dirt and debris off the ground and into the air cycle. Debris is contained completely within the unit, so if you are looking for road sweepers for sale that will completely clear an area without blasting debris back into the local atmosphere, these could be a good choice.

  • Pure Vacuum

There are also pure vacuum sweeper trucks for sale that basically operate like a giant motorised vacuum. Brushes may be used to sweep the debris up, and additional brooms may be used to prevent the majority of debris from being vented back into the atmosphere. One of the uses of this type of sweeper is as a parking lot vacuum sweeper. This type of automatic sweeper is highly effective right under the nozzle, and it can be used on damaged and uneven road surfaces. Buyers that are looking for a reliable, all-round model of road sweeper machine should consider pure vacuum models.

All-Rounder or a Fleet of Road Sweepers for sale

The differing conditions, and access to the different types of industrial floor sweeper available such as regular road sweeper or if he finds a mini road sweeper for sale a mean that many fleet owners have to decide whether to buy different models of used street sweepers for sale for different applications, or look for a single street sweeper vehicle that can meet and combat all of the challenges that may lie ahead.

Water Vs. Waterless Models

Another decision that buyers need to make is whether to opt for a water or waterless road sweeper truck. You can find a good variety of both types of road sweepers for sale, and a lot of fleet managers and sweeper owners in cold environments opt for the waterless version. There is no danger of the water tank freezing, and you will not leave a blanket of ice behind after cleaning the road surfaces.

Used Road Sweepers Planing

There are other options to consider, and decisions to make when looking for a second hand street sweeper for sale. Alternative fuel is becoming more popular than the traditional diesel model, while quiet sweepers are used when cleaning needs to be done at night or early in the morning, and the owner does not wish to upset or rouse locals. It is also worth considering that the cost of used sweepers means that a routine and ongoing maintenance plan should be set up in order to prolong the life of the sweeper, and some used small street sweepers for sale are better suited to easy maintenance than others.

Pros and Cons of 4 Wheel Electric Forklifts

Electric forklifts are quiet in use, and due to their weight and concentrated mass of the battery, they are generally more manoeuvrable than the engine powered equivalents. The cost of recharging the battery overnight on low rate tariff is considerably lesser than replacing gas bottles or filling a tank with diesel fuel. 

Electric fork lift trucks are generally easier to drive than engine powered machines, because they only have an accelerator and a brake pedal. There is no clutch pedal or inching pedal. In the design of the electric forklift, braking happens automatically and electrically as soon as the operator’s foot is removed from the gas pedal resulting in less brake wear. 

Higher initial cost, because of battery and charger is a major disadvantage with the usage of electric forklifts. They are also unavailable for use while the battery is being recharged, unless additional batteries for multi-shift working are available which adds further to the cost, and space must be found for the battery charging station, and a suitable means of changing batteries provided, at shift change-over. 

Electric forklifts need a better floor surface to work on because the higher point loadings on the axles and wheels can cause them to sink in hard standing. Electric forklifts are not really suitable for prolonged use outside during wet weather, because the damp atmosphere causes problems with wiring circuitry and electrical components.

4 Wheeled Forklifts vs. 3 Wheeled Forklifts

A 4 wheel electric forklift has a single steering wheel on the rear of its each corner with a dual acting hydraulic ram. Four wheel electric forklifts come with either cushion or pneumatic tires. They provide better stability and it works well for turning with a heavy load. 

The four wheel forklifts are known for being better for gradeability. It is essential for a company that needs to manage large warehouses to move heavy equipment and machinery around steep areas. Thus  4 wheel forklifts are preferable for companies with large capacity needs and rough flooring areas. 

The load carrying capacity of the 4 wheel electric forklifts is also way bigger than that of the three wheel electric forklifts. With capacities ranging from 1600kg-8000kg the four wheel electric forklifts can be used for specialist heavy lifting applications such as machinery and tool installation including presses, dies & jigs. But, the major limitation of the four wheel forklift is their larger turning circle which makes them less manoeuvrable in a space constrained location.

Used Front Loaded Forklifts at TradeMachines

Front loaded forklifts are used to lift and transport heavy objects from place to place in the work environment. Two frontal prongs, or forks, are used to engage with loads mounted on pallets, which are specially designed to be raised by forklift trucks.

Front Loaded Forklifts And Their Main Manufacturers

Initially developed from the hoists that were used in the 1880s, forklifts came into more widespread use during the First World War, when a shortage of manpower gave rise to a need for machines designed to lift and carry. Front loaded forklifts, as the name implies, have the fork attachments situated at the front of the vehicle on a mast operated by hydraulic cylinders and interlocking rails. Forklifts are generally counterbalanced to offset the weight of the load, and may be powered by electric battery, propane, diesel or petrol. If you are looking to buy a front loaded forklift, then JCB have a strong reputation as a leading manufacturer of reliable and easy to use forklifts. The JUNGHEINRICH range of electric counterbalance front loaded forklifts are renowned for being smooth to operate and robust. TOYOTA remain the most popular and best selling manufacturer of this equipment. However, CROWN have remained consistently in the top ten best selling list for many years. The Grendia range offered by MITSUBISHI are noted for their low maintenance design and superior fuel economy. For heavy trucks the LINDE company are hard to beat.

Reasons To Buy Used Front Loaded Forklifts At Auction

The advantages when you buy a used front loaded forklift at auction are considerable. Firstly, you incur less cost than you would when buying new. Secondly, when you buy used front loaded forklifts you avoid the rapid depreciation in value that you incur when buying new, and expensive, machinery. All of this is a big help when you are keeping a watchful eye on your bottom line. Lastly, front loaded forklifts are robust, so you may well find a bargain that will last you for years when you buy a used front loaded forklift at auction.

3 wheel electric forklift truck and its features

Electric forklifts are quiet and reliable and produce no emissions. They are powered by large, powerful strength batteries which are designed in such a way that they can be recharged up to 1,500 times during their working lifespan. Electric forklifts are powered by a battery of fuel cells that provide power to its electric motors. The electric motors used on forklifts may be either DC or AC types.

As the electric forklift creates no harmful exhaust fumes, it is often the most preferred machine of choice in places where there is limited ventilation and in food processing industries.

As electric forklifts have zero tailpipe emissions, it results in a better and safer working environment for the employees. Capacity ratings and stability of electric forklifts are usually better at high lifting heights, partly due to a lower centre of gravity.

The machine is also mechanically simple as there are no transmissions or torque converters. Additionally, the operator productivity is often higher, since there are typically fewer hand / arm / foot movements required to operate an electric lift truck.

Operating costs of a 3 wheel electric forklift truck

Electric forklifts have the lowest overall operating costs. The charging area should also be well ventilated for safety reasons.

Indispensable in manufacturing and warehouse operations, compact forklifts allow safe and convenient access within space restricted locations.

Compact Forklifts And Their Manufacturers

It was the introduction of hydraulic power and the advent of the first electric forklifts in the 1930s that paved the way for the development of compact forklift trucks. As technology allowed these trucks to be smaller, so it also allowed for the more efficient use of available space in the working environment. Today, for example, drive in racking is designed to have just enough room to allow the ingress and necessary manoeuvres of compact forklifts. MARIOTTI is a major name in the field of compact forklifts. The company's range of 3 wheel trucks with lift capacities ranging from 600 to 1300 kg are known for ease of service and for being low maintenance. They offer a choice of rear, front and all wheel drive options, all of which have electronic curve speed control. Despite boasting lift heights of up to 5.7 metres, these trucks are some of the most compact in their class. Another very popular compact forklift is the TOYOTA Trago 48 electric counterbalance. This has a reputation for versatility, has very user friendly controls and is available in 3 and 4 wheel configurations. The NISSAN Nomad is noted for its excellent fuel efficiency, tight handling and superior manoeuvrability in confined spaces. The on board diagnostics are reportedly first class. For those seeking to buy used compact forklifts with a heavy duty capacity, the HYSTER Fortens range of compact internal combustion engine forklift trucks are well regarded for their power, dependability and excellent all around visibility. They have an overall length of 4130 mm and are available in diesel or LPG variants. The YALE Veracitor VX series is designed specifically for heavy duty in confined areas. If a stand up used compact forklift is required, the CROWN RC 5500 series is ideal for applications where the operator is required to be frequently hopping on and off the truck. These 3 wheel compacts are fitted with the company's exclusive FlexRide operator suspension.

Why to go for Natural Gas Forklifts?

Natural gas is a versatile low carbon cleaner fuel up to 95% cleaner than propane emissions. Forklift trucks are an excellent example of niche vehicle success for natural gas. Natural gas powered forklifts offer convenience and safety unmatched by any other forklift fuels, including battery electric systems. Refuelling can be done very quickly in less than 5 minutes, without the inconvenience or dangers of swapping over heavy LPG bottles. Emissions from a natural gas forklift trucks are considerably lesser than petrol, diesel or LPG forklifts and they are also up to 50% quieter, ensuring safer working environments for the workers. CNG forklifts provide the same heavy duty power as LPG forklifts. Natural gas burns cleaner than gasoline or diesel, which means less wear and tear on engine parts. Natural gas forklifts do not require the battery maintenance of electric forklifts, which can lead to extensive downtime and increased space for charging and storage.

TOYOTA and Natural Gas Forklifts

Tasmanian natural gas distributor, Tas Gas Networks joined hands with TOYOTA Material Handling's Tasmanian dealer FRM TOYOTA a few years back to offer compressed natural gas (CNG) for forklift trucks. Some of the reasons behind this collaboration were the significant cost savings that can be reaped from the usage of natural gas as a fuel for forklifts and the lower emissions of particulate matter and oxides of nitrogen (NOx) than other fossil fuels. Initially, four CNG powered vehicles were introduced in Tasmania including a TOYOTA 8FG25 forklift. Also in February 2005, TOYOTA Material Handling, U.S.A. (TMHU) began offering compressed natural gas as a fuel system option for a number of its forklift models.

Warehouse machinery is used to expedite the storage and movement of goods within a warehouse environment. Items such as pallet trucks, lifting equipment, tow tractors and dock levellers are all used in this regard.

Warehouse Machinery and its Manufacturers

An essential item of warehouse handling equipment is the pallet truck. Also known as a jigger, pump truck or pallet jack, this is used in the lifting and moving of heavier or stacked pallets. Manual pallet trucks use only human energy to lift and move the load. Pumping the handle lowers the wheels and lifts the load, which can then be steered in the desired direction. Powered pallet trucks are motorised and usually electric. Some have a platform on which the operator can ride. Tow tractors are often used to pull heavy loads mounted on wheeled platforms around the warehouse. Stackers and lifters are used to place goods in piles or on warehouse shelving. Dock levellers are used in loading docks to bridge the gap between the transport vehicle and the warehouse floor. The JUNGHEINRICH AM 22 is an excellent basic pallet truck, offering a choice of normal or quick lifts, rubber or nylon wheels and single or double rollers. The CROWN powered pallet trucks are recognised for their exceptional versatility and durability, which makes them very desirable on the used warehouse lifting equipment market. The CROWN WT 3000 offer electronic steering, a shock reducing operator suspension system, programmable performance, four platform configurations and a capacity up to 2.5 tons.

In the field of stand on pallet stackers the CAT NPR 20 N is proving very popular with its small turning circle, optimum driver protection and precise and intuitive controls. The TOYOTA BT Lifter H series is designed to provide a long working life and so is vary much in demand among those buying used warehouse equipment for sale. The ergonomically laid out and compact design of the STILL FU-X and FS-X side seat trucks make them very popular. The CLARK CTX 40-70 tow tractor is known to be highly manoeuvrable, dependable and offers excellent ergonomics. The KELVIN KT60-1 has a formidable reputation, with its small turn radius and 6 ton tow capacity. The ARCO series of dock levellers have proven to be industry leaders and are considered virtually essential by those who use them.

Used side loader forklift: why buy them?

A side loader forklift  is a type of truck that is characterized by the lateral placement of the forks and loading system, so loading and unloading takes place from the side of the vehicle. These industrial trucks are useful in many sectors, i.e. warehousing or construction. Side loader forklifts are designed to carry materials like wood, aluminium and steel. They can be altered to carry concrete and building materials, as well as pallets or other order picking and storage solutions.

How to operate a side loader forklift?

The operating mechanism is simple to understand. Next to the material to be loaded, the trolley pulls out the forks and places the load on the shelves. This is done with the help of an electronic system that allows the load to be moved accurately from the platform elevated by the forks. Some models allow the vehicle to be rotated at a limited angle, allowing the side lift truck to be moved with extreme manoeuvrability.

Side loader forklifts are designed to work in confined spaces. They move easily between dense rows of stacks. As the sideloader can move in tight spaces, it allows storing a lot of materials. The possibility of exploiting the forks by means of vertical movement also makes it possible to optimise the height of the warehouse to the maximum.

What is a high reach forklift?

High reach forklift (also order picker, cherry picker, stock picker or order selector) is different from an ordinary forklift. There is a number of differences between those two types. High reach forklift trucks are almost exclusively used in situations where high racking is arrayed in relatively narrow "corridors". As a result, your average high-reach truck will take up less floor space than its counterbalanced cousins. This is achieved by having two "legs" protrude from the front of the forklift in order to stop it tipping forward, as opposed to counterbalanced forklifts which simply have a large weight on the back of the forklift, taking up valuable space.

Unlike in an ordinary forklift, high reach forklift’s operator stands on the platform and is being lifted together with the forks. In that way he can reach items which are placed at high elevation. High reach equipment comes in when there is a lot of items stored indoors and it would be massively inefficient to use anything other than vertical racking. Reach truck are suitable for narrow aisles and flat floors. Its max lifting height is 10 m. They come in handy especially in the logistics and warehousing industry.

Narrow aisle forklifts - what are they?

Narrow aisle forklifts are essential machinery for those working with a huge amount of material in a confined space. With a narrow aisle lift truck, there is no need to worry about difficult manoeuvring to reach items stored in cramped areas. This type of forklift is designed to optimise working time when space is at a premium. Thanks to the narrow aisle forklift you gain ease of storing as many products as possible. The machine usually has a pair of mobile front forks, capable of rotating on one axis and forking material from different angles without the need to move the vehicle.

Where do I find stand up forklifts for sale?

Stand up forklift (also stand on forklift) is an industrial truck used to lift and stack pallets on top of each other or on shelves at different heights. The truck is controlled by a travelling operator standing in a cab while the truck is in motion.The operator can get on and off the forklift easily to access the pallets. The use of a stand on truck saves a lot of time since there is no seat belt necessary for the operator or no need to set the parking brake. The vehicle is suitable for narrow aisles and confined spaces. 

This type of forklift is popular among beverage and food distributors, grocery stores and warehouses where the operator needs to get on and off the lift frequently. If you would like to purchase a stand up forklift at a great price, have a look at the second hand market. The high-lift pallet truck is designed to not only move palletised goods from one location to another, but it also has the ability to raise the pallet up to convenient height for unloading, etc. The standard high-lift hand pallet truck does not have this high-lift ability.

How Does the High-Lift Pallet Truck Work?

Electric high-lift pallet truck is designed to be operated by one person. The manual version requires the operator to pull or pump the arm of the truck to move the truck or raise the forks and pallet (this version is also known as a manual/hand pump truck). The rechargeable battery powered electric version allows the operator to use buttons and levers to move or raise the pallet. Some versions of this type of warehouse machinery have a tilt facility enabling the raised forks to tilt and tip the load.

Where the High-Lift Pallet Truck Can Operate?

Pallet truck high-lift can be used on hard surfaces such as concrete floors. It can cope with gentle gradients. Electric high lift pallet truck cannot be used on uneven or soft surfaces.

High-Lift Pallet Truck Manufacturers

Some popular manufacturers of electric or manual high lift pallet truck are ATLET, BT, PIMESPO, SIEGFRIED and JUNGHEIRINCH.

A bus is a powered road vehicle that is designed to carry a large number of passengers. They can be used for scheduled public transport, scheduled school transport, for tourism or for private hire.

Buses And Their Leading Manufacturers

The earliest buses were the horse drawn versions of the 1820s, followed by steam models a short time later. Electric trolleybuses came on the scene in the 1880s, and the first commercial buses powered by the internal combustion engine appeared in the mid 1890s. DAIMLER were one of the first companies to become successful in the field of bus manufacturing. In more recent years there has been increased interest in more environmentally friendly buses, leading to electric, hybrid electric, fuel cell, bio diesel and compressed natural gas fuel options. The most common design in the world today is the single deck rigid bus, with minibuses for applications serving fewer passengers, and double decker and articulated buses used to transport greater numbers. The VOLVO B7R is a coach chassis that is available with a range of bodies. Used around the world, it has a reputation for robustness and reliability. The VOLVO Olympian and Super Olympian are rear engined double decker buses that also have a world class reputation and are very popular among those looking to buy used buses. ALEXANDER DENNIS are a world-renowned bus manufacturing company whose products are noted for supremely high quality. On the minibike front the HONDA Grom is a 125-cc compact that is a great alternative to the traditional scooter. In the cruiser category the TRIUMPH Rocket III Roadster is a cool and comfortable front runner that is proving to be in demand from riders looking to buy used motorcycles. Sheet Metal Shears Uses

Shearing machines are found in all industrial and handiwork industries, where profiles are processed. This includes window construction, production of vehicle bodies, and installation of a general tube and pipe constructions. Section shears are often used in industry by the profile manufacturers themselves, to ensure their products are cut efficiently. Metal shears are characterised through their exact cuts and precise processing of profiles. This means that metal shears are a very valuable auxiliary material when producing complex constructions.

Hydraulic Shears Machinery

A sheet metal shear consists of a massive frame, within which the mechanical or electro-hydraulic shears is located. The profiled steel is guided through a fitted opening and then cut at the desired point. Commonly, a shear machine can cut T, U or H profiles. Particularly high-end section shears have an exchangeable cutting tool, that can be used to separate even very complex cross-sections without damaging the component.

Metal shears for sale are often constructed as a combined unit. In this case, there is a usually a metal shear or a hole punch incorporated with the section shear. All of these features require the same lifting mechanism, so a combination of all of these features in one machine is very useful. Shearing machines are either powered manually, by operating the lever, or hydraulic shears. The electric version is more suited for automation. This allows for a large amount of profiled steel to be precisely produced in a short amount of time.

If you are looking for a used sheet metal shear, you should in all cases check the condition and reliability of the used metal shear for sale before purchasing it.

Profile Bending Machines for Full Design Freedom

The challenge of bending profiles is to be able to bring it selectively and exactly into a desired shape. Hollow profiles, like pipes, have the risk associated with them that they can buckle. A kink in a pipe will ruin the workpiece as it cannot be repaired. A profile bending machine contains a clever mechanical system that prevents this from happening and to produce precise radii. There are several different types of profile metal bending equipment. Mandrel bending machines are used for thin-walled pipes with a diameter of only a few centimetres. These machines are made out of a mandrel, a bending tool, a bending head and a counter bearing. During mandrel bending, the profile to be bent is pushed over the mandrel and fixed between the bending tool and the clamp. The mechanic or hydraulically operated bending head turns along the bending axis and thereby, shapes the workpiece. The counter bearing is used as a support for the pipe during the bending process.

Types of Profile Bending Machines

The demands of the bending process are dependent from the bending radius, the strength of the wall and the material. The more brittle the material, the thinner the walls and the smaller the bending radius, the more demanding the bending process will be. The mandrel bending process is most suited to produce high-quality small bending radii. Hardened case-hardened steel is the only material that the bending tool can be made out of. The addition hardening stage is necessary, to guarantee that the working-life of the tool is long enough. The tool can compress or buckle if not hardened, which leads to the formation of creases. During the bending process, these creases have a formative impact on the workpiece, which would render it useless. In addition to using hardened steel, the build up of creases can be prevented by using a crease smoother or by pre-heating the profile. A different tool has to be produced for all areas of application, and therefore mandrel bending is most suited for the production of series and standard components.

Pyramid bending rollers are particularly suited for the individual production of profile radii. They are generally made out of three rollers that are driven towards one another. The desired bend in the profile produced depends on the size of the outer rollers and the depth of the middle roller. The rollers turn and can produce complex bent pipe workpieces. Pyramid bending rollers are commonly used by automobile workshops and plumbers to produce individual profiles like pipes and exhaust pipes. The pyramid bending rollers are available as complete machining centres, which can produce complex pipe and profile in the desired quantity. The company BILGER has a particularly cheap and flexible profile bending machine for sale, which can be used for small companies, assembly work and entrepreneurs. It combines the flexibility of the pyramid bending rollers with the efficiency of the mandrel bending machine. The small bending machine called “Variobieger” can, with a choice of standard tools, be quickly built to suite the requirements of the operator.

Sizes and Types of Profile Bending Machines

The types of motors and operating systems for profile bending machines are designed depending on the demands of the profile. Small and medium sized pipes and rods can be produced using purely mechanical systems like levers, knuckle joint presses and spindles. These profiles are regularly produced depending based on visual judgement and this is usually sufficient for non-critical applications. Half-mechanical bending machines work with manually operated hydraulic motors. With the help of a hand pump, the operator can use the hydraulic system to apply a large amount of targeted force onto the profile. This process is most commonly used for assembly work. It allows the production of individual bends in the profile without requiring electricity. Automatic and fully hydraulic motors are used for metal bending machines. These are available for profiles of all sizes. Particularly large bending machines can be found alongside track and pipeline constructions. The necessary bends are produced on site by mobile stations.

Working with Profile Benders

Profiles are required in the context of a construction. They are an element made up of several components, are used to produce a pre-developed product. The individual production of profiles requires the same skill set, which is found in the occupation profile of those who finish products. The individual production of profiled pieces can also be learned by talented, but otherwise unskilled, workers. The bending of profiles is relatively safe. However, a safety briefing before using a profile bending machine is useful. Mass produced components are fully automatically produced on profile bending machines such as aluminium profile bending machine or upvc profile bending machine. Just like every other production machine, the only tasks required are loading and unloading. Additionally, these products require regular quality control. In order to not have to teach skilled workers how to handle the tools, it is recommended to prepare templates that during the quality control of profiles. The wear and tear on bending tool is minimal. However, the high amount of force, which is required to correctly bend profiles, can drastically affect the counter bearings of the machine. These are usually designed to be adjustable. Strict quality control measures can identify the need for adjustment early enough to prevent wasting products and the requirement for post-production.
