Excavator is the machine that can excavate the soil of various types forcefully and then using hydraulic system a hydraulic force is generated and utilizing this force bucket is pull back towards the machine. Most excavators used in the industry today make use of hydraulics as hydraulics can supply great amount of power by utilizing only minimal resources. A regular excavator would comprise of hydraulic cylinders, a boom, an arm and a bucket. All these components work together to make the excavator functional without much of disruptions. Adjusting the levels of oil in the hydraulic cylinders could greatly affect the accuracy of the hydraulic excavator. Hydraulic excavators have largely replaced the cable excavators which are mammoth earth moving machines which function with the help of cables and ropes. Cable excavators were once used in the mining and construction industries for excavation purposes. The major reasons for replacement of cable excavators by hydraulic excavators can be cited as cheaper costs, faster mobility and easier operation.

Hydraulic Excavators : Components & Build

The different components which make up the hydraulic excavator and the operational features of the individual components are explained below:

Arm - The hydraulic excavator operates on different levels. The first is the arm of the vehicle. The arm is comprised of two hydraulic cylinders, a bucket and a boom, which is on the upper part of the arm. The arm of the hydraulic excavator is analogous to the human arm and moves in two parts: at the wrist and the elbow. Inside of the hydraulic cylinder is a rod, which constitute the inner part of the cylinder, and a piston, which is at the end of the cylinder and enabling the arm to move with the help of oil. If there were no oil in the cylinder, the piston would drop to the bottom, but because of the nature of oil, its volume always stays the same. Oil is pumped through the end of the piston and in turn pushes the rod through the cylinder, thus creating movement of one or both parts of the arm. By controlling the amount of oil is pumped through the valve, the accuracy of the arm can be easily manipulated. This movement is activated by the use of control valves that are positioned inside the cab where the driver seat is located.

Engine - Power in an automobile is normally received straight from the engine but it works differently in a hydraulic excavator. Because the machine uses a lot of force, it is able to move by changing the energy it receives from the engine into hydraulic power.

Swing - One of the functions of this machine is its ability to turn. The swing of the excavator enables it to achieve the turn. The swing circle comprises of several sub-components such as an outer race, an inner race, ball bearings and a pinion. As the outer race turns, the pinion runs alongside the unmoving inner race. The ball bearings work to ensure that this is done smoothly.

Cab - The third part of the hydraulic excavator is the upper structure where the driver’s seat is located and the controls are positioned. With the help of two levers on both side and two in the front, the driver can move both at the same time to control the direction of movement and height.

Feet – Feet represents the base of the excavator. There are two types of excavator bases based on which the excavators can be broadly classified.

Types of Hydraulic Excavators

The two major types of hydraulic excavators used for industrial purposes are: crawler excavators and wheel excavators.

    • Crawler excavators - These are the main excavators widely available in the market. They are usually very big and very large and they always come with very high horsepower. Crawler excavator runs on two endless tracks (chain wheel system). These types of excavators are predominantly used in hilly areas where risks of sliding of machinery are on the verge. Crawler type excavator has low ground pressure because of spreading of load on large area. Therefore, it is also used where soil support is weak.

  • Wheel excavators - Wheel excavator runs on wheels and are used for excavation and loading of dump trucks and most of the time it is only used for plain ground operations. Because of wheel, it is not suitable for hilly areas due to low grip value to the ground. Majority of the excavators run on continuous tracks rather than on wheels, because it is easier to manoeuvre them on a track. Models with wheels lose the advantage of a cab that is located on a pivot because they cannot rotate as easily.

The mobile excavator (also known as wheeled excavator, excavator on tyres) is a haeavy earth moving machinery, predominantly used for construction works. A standard mobile excavator is about 15 tons to 18 tons, but there are mobile excavators up to 24 tons of weight. This type of excavator consists of a 360º swivelling structure equipped with a digging arm. This arm normally is either a mono-boom (one piece boom) or an articulated boom (two piece boom), although there are several other booms developed for special works. At the end of the digging stick you can put a variety of attachments, depending on the work done. The most common attachments for mobile excavators are: buckets of various sizes and designs, hydraulic breakers, grabbles and many more specialized equipment for handling etc.

Wheeled Excavators for Sale

The mobile excavator can drive on the road like a normal vehicle, unlike the necessity of the truck carrying. In addition, the wheeled excavator has fast travelling speed with no damage to the road. But one of the biggest disadvantages posed by the mobile excavators is the stability, especially on rough grounds. As the mobile excavator is mounted on simple tyres or twin tyres, in most cases the stability of the mobile excavators is not enough to secure maximum safety. In order to increase the safety level of the mobile excavators, most wheeled excavators are equipped with at least a hydraulic support blade or two hydraulic outriggers. For rough grounds, they can be equipped as well with four outriggers or a combination of a blade and two outriggers. Though it is less flexible than the crawler excavators which can run on worse road condition or a little swampy pavement, it is still widely utilized in many fields. The working efficiency of a wheedled excavator is not higher than that of a crawler excavator, but when compared with expensive transfer fee of a track excavator, a wheeled excavator is on a favourable economic advantage when frequent transitions are concerned.

Although it has disadvantages, the wheeled excavator is still an important component which plays its role in engineering machinery.

Demolition is the tearing down of building structures completely as against deconstruction in which the building is not totally brought down but some valuable elements of the building are preserved for further or re-use. Demolition of small buildings with just two or three storeys is a relatively simple process when compared to the destruction of complex buildings. The equipments used for demolishing smaller structures are elevated work platforms, cranes, bulldozers. Though the primary application of excavator is digging up of soils for various purposes, some of the types of excavators can be used for demolition activities as well. Demolition excavators are becoming the most preferred machines to be used in this field of application. There are also long reach demolition excavator and high reach demolition excavator models which are used for specific purposes in demolishing tall and high structures.

Demolition Excavator and Wrecking Ball

Wrecking ball is a heavy steel ball, usually suspended and operated from a crane for demolition of the high storeyed buildings. Nowadays, the use of wrecking ball is decreasing as wrecking ball is rarely found in the demolition sites mainly because of its low working efficiency. High reach excavators have largely replaced the wrecking ball used in the demolition of larger buildings as the primary demolition equipment. Also, the working efficiency of high reach demolition excavators is very much higher when compared to that of the wrecking ball. High reach excavators are an extension of the normal excavators with a long boom arm. The swing of the wrecking ball also cannot be controlled effectively while using the same for demolition, thereby leading to more collateral damage. High reach demolition excavators are designed in such a way that they are capable of reaching the upper storeys of the buildings and bring down the buildings in a controlled fashion rather than a haphazard destruction. Thus, high reach excavators are widely used when the amount of collateral damage that could be caused is desired to be less.

There are multiple ways of seeding a field through mechanical means. One of these is by using an air seeder. Air seeders are a part of the farm machinery industry

How air seeder operate

As their name suggests, air seeder work by spraying seed through the air while being towed by a used tractor, thereby achieving a wide and even spread of seeds. By themselves, air seeders to not ensure that the seeds make necessary contact with the soil; because of this, it is necessary for the seed-spraying to be followed with rolling.

Seeding and drilling equipment is a form of farm equipment and is used in the agricultural industry for the sowing of seeds. These functions can be combined in seed drills, which are used to make holes in soil to a specific depth, plant seeds and then cover them over.

Although drilling and seeding equipment can be traced back to the ancient Sumerians and Chinese, it was the pioneering agriculturalist Jethro Tull who perfected the first horse drawn seed drill in 1701. This made possible the economical and waste-free sowing of seeds that helped to pave the way for the Agricultural Revolution. It has been estimated that the use of such equipment can improve the crop yield ratio as much as nine fold. Today we have mechanised seeding & drilling equipment in which seed is metered and the spacing and depth at which seed is planted can be carefully regulated. Many rows of seeds can be planted at the same time by a seed planting machine. DALE DRILLS are renowned for their excellence in following contours, accurate seed placement and economical power requirements. The company manufacture some of the most versatile seed drills on the market. The DALE DRILLS Eco Drill is their flagship model and is a hot item amongst those in the industry seeking to buy used drilling and seeding machines, including lawn seeding equipment and grass seeding machine. Their seeding & drilling equipment is developed on a working farm by farmers for farmers, so you know it has been thoroughly tested in actual farming conditions. Seed drills are agricultural tools that have been in use for hundreds of years, as they can improve crop yields and productivity easily and with minimal effort. Below you will find a detailed overview of the seed drills currently available in the market.

About seed drills

Seed drills are a type of seed sowing machine used on agricultural crops. Seed drills are usually being towed by a used tractor.These machines were created with the objective of delivering an improved and more even seed distribution, therefore reducing the amount of seeds wasted and reducing the chances of over-seeding a field. In addition, the mechanics behind seed drills result in better germination rates and give farmers more control over the sowing process. Overall, seed drills can be considered a productivity tool that aids increase efficiency, reduce waste, and implement cost-effective agricultural production methods. Seed drills are usually being towed by a used tractor.

Types of Seed Drills

Seed drills can be classified according to their capacity and functioning mechanism. In terms of the mechanisms available, farmers can choose between:

- No till seed drill units, which allow them to sow on pretty much every soil type, including those that have not been previously prepared.

- Pneumatic seed drill devices, which are designed to easily cover large areas, as they have working widths of between 4 and 7 metres.

- Precision seed drill units, which come in handy when working on crops that need individual seed planting. These machines can be easily configured to adjust the distance between rows milimetrically to suit specific crop requirements to perfection.

- Zero till seed drill units are especially suited to areas where water is scarce and can result in yield increases of up to 7 per cent. Zero till drills are also highly cost-efficient, as they consume little fuel.

In terms of their capacity, small seed drill units (sometimes labelled ATV seed drill or compact tractor seed drill units) usually have a hopper capacity that ranges between 400 and 1,000 litres. Hand seed drill units also fall under this category. At the other end of the scale, seed drills that have working widths of between 6 and 15 metres and higher yield a high acreage output.

Things to look for in a seed drill machine

When choosing a drill seeder, it is important to look for things like the quality and robustness of seed drill parts, especially if you are after a used seed drill for sale. Other things to look for in both new and used seed drill machines are the hopper's capacity, and whether they incorporate a towable fertilizer spreader. Farmers may also want to consider looking into seed drills for specific purposes, such as grass seed drill units (sometimes called grass seeder drill machines), which ensure that grass and clover seeds are planted at the right depth (no deeper than 1cm).

Harrows are agricultural farm machinery implements used for breaking up residues, uprooting of weeds, coverings seeds and smoothening of the soil surface. Harrows, including grass harrows and drag harrows, are of different types. The most common ones are: disc harrows, chain harrows, tine harrows, spike type harrows and spring type harrows. Used Disc harrows are better than the other conventional types of harrows in pulverising the soil but at the same time they also require more power input. There are also powered harrows which are single pass secondary tillage tools mounted on tractors and uses the power from the tractor’s Power Take off (PTO) to drive the harrow tines in a reciprocating or rotary manner. The power harrows have nowadays replaced the separate operations performed by the disc, spring and spike type harrows. The power harrows can also be sub-divided into four types as: reciprocating, spike rotary, semi-rotary and rotary harrows.

What is laboratory technology and what machines does it use?

Laboratories are used to examine chemical, physical, biological, medical and technical objects, and their interactions. They are also used to undertake production processes in controlled environments. Laboratory technology, like apparatuses, machines, devices, tools and materials, require a high level of quality and cleanliness. The type of technology used depends on the ultimate goal of the laboratory. The equipment used in chemical and biological laboratories is commonly made out of glass because it is inert, heat resistant and easy to clean. Additionally, chemical and physical processes are easily observed when undertaken behind glass. The disadvantage of using hard glass material for chemical processes is that it is very brittle.

Special requirements for the measuring technology used in laboratories

Accuracy is of great importance and can only be ensured when using particularly precise and sensitive measuring equipment. This provides defined and constant environmental conditions. Humidity can, for example, influence weights of around a microgram. Thermal expansion and other influences on the measuring equipment itself need to be prevented. A suitable exhaust system is required when working with materials that potentially create toxic gases or steam. The extracted air then also needs to be cleaned using an additional system. Therefore, laboratory technology also includes ventilation and air conditioning equipment. This equipment aids work processes that are easily affected by contaminated air, for example, when manufacturing semiconductors or solid state physics. Containers and apparatuses also need to be particularly clean and laboratories often use ultrasonic baths to clean these materials. Even though the situation is different in a physics laboratory, it is still important that highly accurate measuring equipment is used in controlled environments.

Where is laboratory technology used?

It is applied for research, teaching and production. Simple chemical and physics laboratories can be found in schools. The amount of photography laboratories has decreased in recent times, but despite the development of digital photography, they are still commonly used. High quality prints can be produced from digital photos if printed on real photographic paper. There is an advantage to using chemical photographic materials in artistic and school settings. The technology required for photography mainly consists of components that are specially designed for this purpose. However, there are also overlaps with general chemical laboratory technology: the tools used to produce the ready-made solutions for photographic chemicals; and the accurate thermometer, suited for chemicals, with a resolution of at least a half of a degree. In universities and high schools, laboratories are required for both teaching and for research. This is determined by the quality of the technology, as well as other standards. The medical industry uses a laboratory for research, diagnoses and for production (e.g. dental veneers or dentures). Laboratory technology is used in industry and in the commercial setting for specific production processes and research. For example, the operation of a precise CNC jig boring machine demands highly precise measuring equipment, and it has high standards for the conditions of its surroundings.

Industrial Food Processing Machinery

Nowadays, a large variety of food products are processed and prepared. This increases their shelf life and reduces the time needed to prepare dishes. In order to still ensure long shelf lives and the best possible preparation of food, these products need to be produced with great care. Therefore, the highest priority for food processing is
hygiene! Irrespective of which food processing technology or machine is being used, all machines in the food industry need to be rust and emissions-free, can be easily disassembled and are fully sterilised. Machines in this industry are most commonly made out of rust-free stainless steel. This material does not corrode, it has the required stability and it does not need to be additionally coated. Stainless steel is most suited for very high temperatures, it can be cleaned with very hard or sharp cleaning utensils, and it can be recycled again and again. This means that these types of machines for the food industry are the most expensive on the market.

The Steps of Food Processing Equipment

The first step in food processing  equipment is cleaning the input product. Whether it is apples, carrots, fish or other crops, cleaning the foodstuffs is always the first stage. There are a large variety of cleaning machines available on the market. Simple machines consist of a conveyor belt, upon which the food products are led through the process. High pressure nozzles are used to ensure that all dirt particles are removed. High-end machines are constructed to suit each individual pre-product. After cleaning, the pre-product is then further prepared. Fruits are cored, peels are removed and undesired components of meat products are removed. Unlike industrially produced products, fruit, nuts and vegetables are not standardised, which makes the demand for manual labour very high when working with these products. The tools used also count as part of the machines for the food industry. After the pre-products are cleaned and the undesired parts have been removed, they are portioned. This work can be undertaken by a wide range of fully automatic cutting machines. This includes, among others, machines used to cut the pre-products into strips or cubes, and grinders used to make spreads and creams. After the products are cut into portions, they are sent to be mixed. Mixing machines can be used to prepare a large number of foodstuffs ranging from pizza toppings to stews. Depending on the type of food, the mixing machine is either equipped with a baking, cooking or sterilisation machine.

The combination stage follows the mixing and cooking steps of the finished food products. This is where the various foodstuffs are put together, that cannot be prepared at the same time. For example, pizza toppings are first baked before they can be placed onto the base. These machines are made out of a number of conveyor belts and positioning systems which put the various components together into a finished product. The structure of the machine can vary greatly, depending on the product. There are a lot of possibilities for the combination step of finished products, from a fully automatic process to solely manual processing. One or more work steps always comes after this step, to prepare the final product. After the combination and finishing stages, the final product is packaged. Disposable packaging is most commonly used for this purpose, with exception of some beverages. Disposable packaging is always sterilised. The demand of cleaning reusable products is not proportional to the production costs for disposable packaging.
Reusable packaging is very robust, to ensure that it can be reused. In order to ensure sustainable consumption of materials, a piece of plastic packaging that is used 20 times cannot weigh 20 times that of foil packaging. However, this type of packaging also requires 20 times higher transportation costs, which cancels out the savings. Therefore, disposable packaging will remain an industry standard for a long time. Deep freeze products are frozen after they are packaged. There are several advantages to freezing products, including that less preservatives are required. Depending on the product, some chemical preservatives can be completely avoided. For frozen ready meals, the greatest level of preparation has already been undertaken in the factory. Customers just need to heat the food up and then it is ready for consumption. The ideal
preservation method for fresh crops is deep freezing. Rapid freezing ensures that pees, beans, strawberries and cabbage retain their vitamins. This means that the vegetables are as digestible and as rich as if they were freshly bought at the weekly market.
The industry has a large variety of machines ranging from
wash systems, stirrers, sterilisation units, baking and cooking stations, minimising machines, portioners, packaging machines and deep freezers. There is a very wide selection of suitable machines.

Buying Used Food Processing Equipment

The biggest enemy of industrial food production is dirt. This does not only include waste material from the production process, but also paint particles, metal debris, lubricants, cleaning products and other undesired dirt. If the dirt is only first discovered by the customer, this can have dramatic consequences. Food production factories are regularly monitored and often have unannounced visits from the authorities. Unauthorised dirt can quickly lead to the whole factory being shut down. The demanding task of monitoring all potential sources of dirt is thereby the highest priority of machine operators in the food industry. Due to this, second-hand machines are usually in excellent condition. However, they should be thoroughly examined before bought. There are companies that are specialized in repairing machines used for food processing products. These companies are able to repair almost any machine. However, it is very important to see a machine’s legal documents before buying it. Many processes that were used in the past are no longer used today. The health authorities will be able to issue valid information about this topic.

Working With Food Processing Machines

What ever is important for the food processing technology is also important for the employees. Hygiene is of the highest priority when handling food products. In addition to basic briefing and training, wearing the right work clothes is particularly important for workers.
Hair nets, mouth guards, gloves and aprons are standard items of clothing required when working with food products. Even the mechanic needs to be properly trained for their reparation and maintenance work, to ensure that no work materials end up in the production process.

How is power generation understood?

Power generation has to do with the generation of electrical power, and sometimes other forms of power, out of primary energy sources. The term is technically not correct, because the process includes transforming energy between different forms, rather than actually generating it. Generally, the definition is understood. It occurs most commonly in large technical systems called power plants.

Generating energy away from power plants

Smaller systems are used to: provide mobile power generators that have a high demand for energy; as an emergency power supply to ensure security in energy supply; and in the renewable energy sector. Mobile power generator systems and emergency power generators usually consist of a combustion engine with an attached generator. When energy demand is very high, diesel motors are used. Smaller systems ranging from 1 to 2 kW include with an Otto engine. Additionally, there are also very small power generators, with less than 1 kW of power. These have two-stroke engines.

Conventional Power Generators

Power generation from fossil fuels and nuclear power is a process that has several stages, in which the primary energy is first transformed into heat and then into mechanical energy. The desired form of electrical energy is then created within the generator. In order to increase the utilisation of primary energy, the inevitable losses in energy that occur in the form of waste heat can be used be used in suitable facilities as heat. This will increase the overall efficiency of these machines. However, a combined heat and power unit can also be used in order to increase the efficiency of producing heat energy. Combined heat and power is usually applied on a large scale with power plants that are connected to district heating networks. Large power plants generally require longer transportation routes and bigger networks to distribute district heating. This restricts the areas of application for combined heat and power systems in this sector. To avoid these disadvantages, smaller block heating stations can be installed closer to the consumer. Particularly small machines can also be built with motors from the car manufacturing sector. They are usually suited, for example, to supply single or multi-family houses. With these power generating machines, heat is the desired form of energy and the electrical energy is just a high-end side product.

Generating power from renewable sources

Contrary to conventional power plants, the conversion of energy occurs in a small, direct way, even in most large-scale renewable power plants. Hydroelectric power stations and wind turbines generate electricity directly from the energy of movement. In photovoltaic cells, the energy from the suns rays is transformed into electrical energy through solar panels and geothermal systems. A direct transformation of energy also occurs with heat pumps. Thermal energy is brought from one temperature level to another. For a heat pump, the inputted energy in the form of liquid or gaseous fuels is required for the maintenance of the process cycle. This is particularly important when using heat pumps for generating cold air for cooling units (e.g. household refrigerators).

Important milestones during the development of power generators

The history of power generation is tightly connected with the development of industry and is characterised in several large chunks. Until the 1970s, there was a direct relationship between the development of the economy and the consumption of energy. The oil crisis in 1973-1974 moved the focus towards energy saving and this resulted in the discovery that the economy could grow without energy consumption rising. At the end of the 20th century the limit of fossil fuels became known. This was particularly relevant for oil, which is an important resource for the chemical industry and many other aspects of everyday life. The influence of the industrialisation’s massive consumption of fossil fuels on the environment and climate, resulted in a need to change the way power is generated. Even nuclear power generators are not been identified as the ideal alternative to fossil fuels, due to the inherent problems associated with it. In the lead up to the third millennium, rising energy prices, technical challenges, motivations made through environmental policy and governmental subsidies in many countries has increased competitiveness in generating power from renewable sources.

Where are systems used for power generation?

Large power plants are operated by a few utility companies that work over several regions. Medium sized systems are available in industry and at a municipal level, for the regional supply in the case of e.g. public-owned utility companies. Subsidies from the government are available to install and operate systems that generate power from renewable sources. These are used in all sectors and by large utility companies and individual consumers. Wind energy provides an income stream for utility companies and for farmers, who could tap into this new source of income by generating power. In the private sector, power generation usually occurs through use of photovoltaics, thermal power from solar energy and combined heat and power. Additionally, heat pumps are used for geothermal energy, ambient heat and to increase the efficiency of solar thermal systems. The profits from combined heat and power units can be increased by installing heat storage tanks, which can be accessed at times of high levels of consumption.

Plastics Processing Process

Because of the properties of polymers, it is possible to mould them and modify their shape using different manufacturing processes collectively termed as Plastic processing. Plastics processing is a  form conversion process. Plastic raw materials in the form of

powder, pellets, beads are heated, melted and then transformed into usable plastic products through plastic processing equipment and tooling. Over the past century, plastic processing has evolved from crude equipment, in which melting and forming of material was a strenuous task to the present microprocessor controlled plastic processing equipment. A well-maintained processing machine can easily last for at least  20 years. This is the reason for the growing trend towards buying used plastic processing equipment.

Types of Plastics Processing

Moulding and extrusion are the two common processing methods for Thermoplastic resins. Moulding involves non-continuous processes such as injection moulding, blow moulding, rotational moulding, and compression moulding, in which parts are made in a closed mould. In extrusion, the plastic pellets are melted by a screw conveying system and forced to flow through a die. Calendering, thermoforming and casting are other operations through which thermoplastics can be processed. Generally used processing methods for thermosetting plastics are compression moulding, transfer moulding, and injection moulding. Fiber-reinforced thermosets are fabricated by specialised techniques namely open-mould processing, protrusion and reaction injection moulding.

Extrusion

Extrusion is a process in which plastic pellets are fed into a heated cylinder where it is driven by rotating screws compacting and squeezing it through a die to give a finished or semi-finished product with the desired profile.

Blow Moulding

Blow moulding is a simple process where compressed air is introduced underneath a pre-heated sheet of thermoplastic material forcing the material into a mould cavity, or allowing it to expand freely.

The reforming

It is basically the opposite of Blow moulding. Instead of the plastic sheet being forced into a mould by air pressure, in vacuum forming the air is drawn out from the bottom of the softened plastic sheet, so it is forced over or into a mould by atmospheric pressure.

Extrusion Blow Moulding

It is a combination of extrusion and blow moulding and is often used when there is a sudden change in thickness of the product such as the presence of a narrow neck. The plastic material is first extruded into a tube shape into an open die. The die is then closed to seal the ends of the tube and the air is blown in forcing the plastic tube which then takes up the shape of the die cavity.

Injection Moulding

Injection moulding is one of the most common of all plastics manufacturing processes in which the polymer in the form of granules is heated and forced into a closed mould. As very high pressure is required to feed the fused polymer into the mould, the machine and the mould should be capable of withstanding the force involved during operation.

Rotational Moulding

Rotational moulding is used for producing hollow thermoplastic products such as drums, storage tanks and litter bins. A pre-determined amount of plastic is placed in a closed mould which is then thoroughly heated in an oven to a set temperature and rotated slowly around both vertical and horizontal axes.

Calendering

In calendaring, the fused thermoplastic is extruded onto heated rotating rollers that squeeze the material into a continuous sheet or film.

Compression Moulding

It is one of the oldest techniques of manufacturing which is mostly used for the processing of thermosetting plastics. A pre-heated lower mould cavity which has the thermosetting polymer is subjected to further heat and pressure provided by a press. Polymerization and the flow of the plasticized material within the mould take place due to the excess pressure and heat applied.

Used Machine Tools for sale

All machines, which can be used to transform preliminary products and raw materials into finished products, are called machine tools. They are differentiated between cutting, joining and forming tools. A machine tool is any machine that operates by other than hand power in employing a tool to work on metal or other rigid materials. Machine tools are used for drilling, boring, shearing, cutting, shaping and grinding. Used Machine Tools can be found in many different auctions on TradeMachines.

Machine Tools And Their Major Manufacturers

Machine tools as we know them today were created when the toolpath, or relative movement between the tool and the work piece, was first guided by the machine itself rather than by the direct guidance of a human hand. Early lathes and potter's wheels could perhaps be seen as the pioneering forms of this kind of equipment. Today there is a huge variety of machine tools available, whether powered hydraulically, electrically or via a line shaft. Examples include grinding machines, milling machines, broaching machines, lathes, hones, shears, planers, saws, screw machines, drill presses, hobbing machines and gear shapers. The JUNKER group is a definite global leader when it comes to high speed CBN grinding machines, offering equipment ranging from individual machines up to entire production lines. The TOYODA company have a reputation for producing excellent horizontal boring mills. In the field of drill presses, RYOBI and CRAFTSMAN seem to lead the field. WAGNER are noted for high quality heavy duty lathes, as are BINNS & BERRY, who combine acclaimed innovation and technology in their outstanding Versa-Turn 7 heavy duty flat bed lathes. CLIMAX offer a range of world class precision milling machines. The OHIO BROACH AND MACHINE company are specialists in broaching machines and have a sterling reputation in the trade. MITSUBISHI and LORENZ are very popular brands of gear shapers. If you are looking to buy machine tools you can find items such as those mentioned above in used machine tools auctions.

Metalworking Machines

Metalworking machines include a lot more than is commonly thought. Metalworking machines do not just encompass bending and milling metal products. It also includes surface treatment, refining and changing the material characteristics of a workpiece. These machines are usually stable therefore to buy used metalworking machinery would be a good idea to save costs.

Forming Metal with metal machines

There are three different types of metalworking processes. “Forming” within metal production includes everything that has to do with casting metal to produce finished products. This includes casting, injection moulding and die casting processes. These differ greatly in terms of their structure, type and size. Cast products are produced in a foundry. The prepared molds are filled with liquid metal directly out of the furnace using heavy lathes. This work can be undertaken with remote control, but it cannot be done automatically with the proper equipment. Die casting machines only have a small supply for molten metal, but this is continually refilled. They can automatically produce a large amount of finished die cast products.
The second form of metalworking is usually called “
forming”. This is when plastic or cold pre-products are shaped using a specific application of pressure.  This includes bending, forging and pressing processes. There are a large number of metalworking machines, which could be used to undertake these processes.
The third metal forming process is separation, which is undertaken through processes without a tool including turning, milling, cutting, burning and sawing, or when using equipment, punching.

Treating Metal Surfaces

The treatment of metal surfaces is undertaken to protect the workpiece against corrosion, for aesthetic reasons and to improve the mechanical characteristics of the material. These processes include grinding, targeted roughening and polishing. There are various metal working machines used for these processes including grinding machines and sand blasters. Because of this is recommendable to buy used metal working machinery and with that save some money.

Coating

Galvanizing and pigment based processes are used to coat metal. The galvanizing processes are characterized by their ability to produce permanent surfaces. This includes galvanizing, chrome plating and gold plating. Galvanizing and chrome plating are technically very demanding processes. Therefore, pigment based processes are usually used where it the technical requirements are not as high. This includes powder coating and lacquering. There are technical solutions and special metalworking machines available for both processes as well as used metal working machinery should be considered as they are totally profitable.

 

Changing Material Characteristics

Cast and forged products usually do not have the desired characteristics and so after the forming processes, annealing and hardening processes are used. Furnaces and hardening metalworking machines are available for this task. These are also included under the overarching term of used metal working machinery.

High lift order picker forklift - auctions & manufacturers 

A high-lift order picker (also called order picker or order picker forklift) is a vehicle for two-dimensional order picking man-to-goods (when the operator picks the goods and moves to the delivery dock). High lift order pickers are industrial trucks and can be moved freely on the floor. They belong to man-up forklifts, i.e. the driver's cab is lifted together with the load section, so the vehicles are perfectly suited for order picking. 

High lift order picker and its structure

A high lift order picker consists of a compact chassis with a lift mast attached. Most of order pickers have a telescopic system to reach the required heights. They can reach a lifting height of more than 14 metres - which corresponds to the height of a five-storey building when accepting 1 floor = 2,6 metres.

A high-lift order picker can be designed as a vehicle or as a manual lifting device. These are usually three-wheeled vehicles with a narrow turning circle - a characteristic that is necessary for driving onto a high-bay warehouse. High-bay warehouses can accommodate many goods on a small footprint.

High lift order pickers are usually electrically operated. Particularly powerful variants are equipped with a gas engine, whereby the vehicles with the gas drive are rather rare due to exhaust emissions.

The load capacity of high-lift order pickers depends largely on the model and manufacturer. However, it can reach up to 1.5 tonnes. The maximum driving speed of these industrial trucks is approximately 12 km/ h.  

High lift order pickers can be extended with numerous accessories. Thanks to the load handling devices (LHD), whole pallets can be lifted. The removal and storage of goods is carried out very quickly and easily with the help of order pickers up to the highest shelves. In addition, they have the advantage that the order picker moves up together with the driver's cab and the LHD. 

Where are high lift order pickers used?

Order pickers are commonly used in high-bay warehouses. The order picker machine is the ideal aid for storing and removing incoming and outgoing products. Like other vehicles this type, high-lift order pickers can also be equipped with recording systems. The laser and barcode systems are more and more often being replaced by RFID (Radio-frequency identification) chips in modern dispatch warehouses. These radio-based recording systems are optically independent and can be used to locate a product as well as to register and deregister it. Equipped with an RFID sensor, a high-lift order picker in a high-bay warehouse is a particularly powerful tool.

Electric platform truck - use, manufacturers and online auctions

Electric platform trucks (also known as electric pallet jacks or electric trolley carts) are industrial trucks designed for manual control only. Those electric powered vehicles are transport aids in many warehouses, factories, or retail stores. They are also useful at airports or train stations, since they can transport luggage fast and easily over medium or long distances. A similar truck, milk float, is used in the United Kingdom for milk delivery.

Electric platform trucks come in different platform sizes and capacities. They are suitable for both indoor and outdoor use. However, if you need a vehicle for extremely uneven outdoor surfaces, you may have a look at rough terrain electric platforms, which may be more fitting for bumpy areas.

The trucks offer warehouse and stock workers the capability to easily move items from one location to another. They offer high productivity with load capacity up to 2 tonnes and top speed up to 25 km/h. Their compact size and manoeuvrability will be useful in narrow aisles of a warehouse.

Dump Trucks and Their Manufacturers

The earliest motorized dumper trucks were developed in Europe in the very early 20th century, but it wasn't until demand boomed during the First World War that the manufacture of these vehicles truly took off. Today the standard dump truck is a full truck on a chassis, the load section being mounted directly onto the frame and raised by hydraulics located behind the cab. Most have one front axle with one or more tandem axles. Variants on the basic idea include the semi trailer end dumper truck, in which the trailer itself houses the hydraulic hoist; the bottom dumper, which has a dump gate in the belly of the trailer, allowing the driver to deposit in a windrow formation; and the bucket truck, which facilitates the depositing of the load to left or right. The BELAZ company of Belarus produce the world's largest dumper truck; a 26 foot high, 65-foot long titan among big dump trucks. Another big company to manufacture the dump truck attachment and the whole vehicle is the world renowned MEILLER. So when it comes to the most popular and highest rated dump trucks for sale, who leads the pack?

The VOLVO F series has a stratospheric reputation amongst construction industry insiders, whereas SCANIA dump trucks are widely regarded as both reliable and safe in the toughest of working conditions. The 114SD, FLD SD and Coronado SD models from FREIGHTLINER are noted for their for their power, fuel economy, and robust design. CATERPILLAR, HITACHI, KENWORTH, TATA, and KOMATSU are the other market leaders today. All of these big name brands have reliable equipment, including mining and mini truck dump models, making choosing the most suitable option a little far, but it's a good problem to have.

What is a rapid radial drilling machine?

A rapid radial drilling machine is a step up from the conventional radial drilling machine, which is based on the table or pillar drilling machine. Just like simple table drilling machines, radial drilling machines are known for their high level of repeat accuracy and ability to create straight, accurate holes in clamped-down raw material. In addition to the entire boom being able to pivot, rapid radial drilling machines have a particularly high rotation speed, quick feed and high level of machine stability. Rapid radial drilling machines also allow for particularly efficient production of hole templates in resistant material.

Where are rapid radial drilling machines used?

Rapid radial drilling machines are generally used in areas of mechanical engineering, where conventional radial drilling machines can no longer be efficiently used. Radial rapid drilling machines are manually operated machines, which are not so suitable for series production. Just like radial drilling machines, the workpieces need to be well clamped in. The production of individual pieces or small series components can be very efficiently undertaken on these machines. They are usually only used in special facilities, as they require much higher costs than their conventional counterparts.

What is the structure of a rapid radial drilling machine?

The basic structure of a rapid radial drilling machine consists of a pillar with a round cross-section. This pillar has a cantilever arm attached to it, whose height can be adjusted. The drilling machines is then attached to this arm. The workpiece is attached to a separate work table. The drilling machine can be moved up and down, and also backwards and forwards along the boom. The boom can pivot, which means that the drilling machine can reach all areas of the workpiece.

Rapid radial drilling machines are made as mid-sized industrial drilling machines. In addition to the extensive adjustment possibilities to the drilling tool, rapid radial drilling machines can also be equipped with cooling lubricant. Rapid radial drilling machines are more stable than normal radial drilling machines, and are just as sensitive to misuse. The cutting and lifting power, which is created during the process, is the same as that that occurs on conventional machines.

Since rapid radial drilling machines are cutting machines, they need to be regularly cleaned.

What is an automatic punching machine?

An automatic punching machine is a machine tool, which is used to separate thin-walled materials. Automatic punching machines are closely related to punching press. As they were further developed, automatic punching machines no longer required human staff for operation, unlike the conventional punching press.

Where are automatic punching machines used?

A automatic punching machine is applied where a large amount of series components need to be produced in a very short space of time. They are most suited for processing wood panels, plastic panels, plastic films, rubber materials and sheet metal. In addition to reducing the need for permanent handling, automatic punching machines have a much higher output rate than manual punching press. This means that they are also very economic. Useful additions for automatic punching machines are industrial robots or reels. Cut-to-length lines are also often equipped with a punching machine.

What types of automatic punching machines are available

Generally, all punching presses can be transformed into automatic punching machines. Due to the automatic nature of these machines, a lot of safety features that are required for manual punching presses are no longer needed. Automatic punching machines are pneumatically operated in the packaging industry. An automatic punching machines is often integrated into the assembly lines for the production of cartons and film packaging. For metal processing, automatic punching machines are electro-mechanically operated. The most common types are knee lever punches, spindle-powered punches or punches with an eccentric drive. Hydraulically operated machines are less common. Hydraulic punches are only used for very tough or particularly thick material. The hydraulically operated punching process is much slower than the electromechanical or pneumatic punches. This means that they are very inefficient when run automatically.

There is a higher amount of pressure required for the separation of material, particularly sheet metal, than for forming processes. Automatic punching machines, including automatic paper punching machine, automatic die punching machine, automatic spiral punching machine and automatic hole punching machine, can also be used as an automatic press. Automatic punching machines can produce a large amount of processed material in a short amount of time. It is important to have continual quality control. The processes of an assembly line, where an automatic punching machine is integrated, all need to be very precisely coordinated with one another. Without continual monitoring of the production process and results, there is always the risk that a lot of waste will be produced.

The Structure of a Drilling Machine

Drilling machines contain a motor, a gear, a guide, a chuck and an interchangeable drill. In most cases, the motor is electric. However, there are also pneumatically operated drilling machines available. Hydraulically operated motors are rare and only useful for very difficult conditions. The speed of the drill machine is monitored by a potentiometer that is attached to the motor or by the gear mechanism. For handheld machines, operators are in control of guiding the drill and feeding in the material. These drilling machines are often used for areas that are inaccessible, assembly work and for reparations. A hand drilling machine is uncommonly used for mass production, where box column drills and pillar drills are more commonly used so it can be considered heavy equipment. The drilling table contains (especially when used in the metal industry) a clamping device. This is so the operator of the drilling machine only has to worry about positioning and guiding the drill. The step-up from these types of drills is the automatic drilling center, where a feed system and a sensor take over the tasks usually undertaken by the operator. These drill machines make it possible to have high processing rates in mass production. Tool-less chuck systems are also now commonly used, rather the formerly used sprockets. Structure of a Metal Shear Machine

The key components of a metal plate shear are a table which has support arms that hold the sheet, stops that secure the sheet, lower and upper straight-edge blades on which the actual cutting takes place and a gauging device which is used to position the sheet precisely.

Area of Operation of Plate Shears

Plate shear machines have different applications in different industries. Some of their key areas of operation include steel furniture industries, automobile production, refrigeration, control panel and door frame manufacturing.

Metal Plate Shears Works

The working of a shear machine is exceedingly simple. The plate that needs cutting is usually placed between the lower and upper blades. The blades are then forced together against the metal plate. The shearing force applied is increased until it exceeds the ultimate shear strength of the metal being cut. At this point the metal starts separating. Normally, the lower blade remains stationary as the upper blade moves up and down.

Drilling is an operation of making a circular hole by removing a volume of metal from the job by a cutting tool called drill. Drilling machines are generally used to originate through or blind straight cylindrical holes in solid rigid bodies and/or enlarge (co-axially) existing (pre-machined) holes. The radial drilling machine is one kind of drilling machine classified based on the constructional feature of the machine. A radial drill machine or radial arm press is a large geared drill head that is mounted on an arm assembly that can be moved around to the extent of its arm reach. The radial, vertical and swing movement which the machine is capable of, enables to locate the drill spindle at any point within a very large space required by large and odd shaped jobs. There are some more versatile radial drilling machines as well where the drill spindle can be additionally swiveled and / or tilted.

Construction of a Radial Drilling Machine

The radial drilling machine consists of a heavy, round vertical column supporting a horizontal arm that carries the drill head. The arm can be raised or lowered on the column and can also be swung around to any position over the work and can be locked in any position. The drill head containing mechanism for rotating and feeding the drill is mounted on the radial arm and can be moved horizontally on the guide-ways and clamped at any desired position. These adjustments of arm and drilling head permit the operator to locate the drill quickly over any point on the work. The table of a radial drilling machine may also be rotated through 360 deg.

Powerful drive motors are geared directly into the head of the machine and a wide range of power feeds are available as well as sensitive and geared manual feeds. Depending on the different movements of the horizontal arm, table and drill head, the radial drill machine can be classified into the following three types:

  •  Plain radial drilling machine
  •  Semi universal drilling machine and
  •  Universal drilling machine

Radial Drilling Machine and its Applications

Radial drilling machine is considered to be the most versatile machine among the drill presses. It is used primarily for drilling medium to large and heavy work pieces as it is easier to manoeuvre large work pieces with the radial arm drilling machine. Radial arm drilling machines cover a huge area which is solely dependent on the length of the arm. Other than just drilling of blind and through holes, radial drilling machines are capable of other operations such as boring, reaming, counter sinking, lapping, etc.

A metal punching machine is a one from many of the sheet metal working machinery category and its quickly and efficiently punch holes in sheet metal.

For anything other than craft work at home, punching machines - including hydraulic punching machine, die punching machine, CNC punching machine or automatic punching machine - can be used to punch accurate holes quickly and efficiently, in a range of metal sheets and blanks.

Efficiency and Quality in Punching Machines

The aim of a punching machine is to generate high productivity while maintaining minimum consumption of the raw material. Too much waste means that you pay too much for the sheet metal, while poor productivity levels can mean missed orders, delayed production, and a dip in revenue. Such CNC punching machines or laser punching machines could thus be essential in terms of productivity.

Punch Tools

Basic metal punches usually consist of a single head, or tool, and if you only need to cut the same shape, and the same diameter of hole, every time, then this may prove adequate. A single tool can also be used to cut different shapes, so that a circle can become a figure 8, and so on. However, if you have different requirements for different jobs, then you will need a multi-tool metal punching machine. Some models of punching machine for sale can hold up to 50 tools making them functional and flexible.

Pressure in Punching Machines

You should consider the amount of cutting pressure that will be required to stamp holes in the material that you are cutting. The sheet thickness multiplied by the outer circumference of the punch multiplied by the sheer strength of the material, divided by 1000 will give the punching power in tonnes, and you should ensure that the punching machine for sheet metal that you buy is able to deliver this kind of cutting power.

Pillar Drilling Machines for Metalworking

Pillar drilling machines consist of a column, upon which the head of the drilling machine is mounted. Column drilling machines stand independently while pillar drill machines are built as a table machine. They have a small worktable, upon which the workpiece is attached using a clamping device or screw clamps. A lifting device is attached to the drilling machine. An adjusting wheel and an (in most cases) automatic lever are used to guide the drilling spindle towards the workpiece. The fact that the workpiece is attached means that it does not slip. The pillar drill machine is always guided vertically, which allows for precise holes to be drilled.

Uses of the Pillar Drill Machines

Pillar drills are used to process plastic, wood workpieces and where you need to boring holes in metal. They are used to create a variety of holes including through holes, threaded holes, guide holes or other types of holes. Pillar drilling machines are also very popular among hobbyists. They are not suited for producing series components. This is mainly because the workpiece has to be clamped in, which makes the processes on this machine quite slow.

When operating a pillar machine, it is important to wear protective googles and have respiratory protection. Wearing gloves is not required when working with a bench pillar drill.

For wood and plastic processing, it is necessary to have an additional extraction system. For metalworking, cooling lubricants can be used to ensure significantly better results. As cutting machines, used pillar drills require a lot of cleaning. Pillar drilling machines are available as compact table machines for work at home up to mid-sized industrial machines.

Deep hole drilling machines are machines tools that drill precise holes into massive metal blocks or particularly long solid bars. Deep hole drills can be up to 50 metres long.

What is the structure of a deep hole drill?

A deep hole drilling machine is very similar to a lathe. The difference is that the workpiece is fixed in place, while the tool (the drill) slowly rotates on the desired area where the hole is to be drilled. The drill is restricted by bezels. These bezels are adjustable, so that the drill can go as deep into the material as required. A deep hole drill machine has an internal cooling lubricant. The deep drill is equipped with a hollow channel, through which a large amount of cooling lubricant flows. If there was no coolant, the rubbing between the tip of the drill and the material would quickly lead to the drill seizing up. This would damage the drill and the workpiece. The cooling lubricant is also used to bring the metal chippings out of the hole. Without this, the drilling process would very quickly get blocked up. As an integral component to ensure that the machine continues to function reliably, cooling lubricant is required for deep hole drilling machines. Deep drills are available as small and mid-sized drills with hard metal tips, which are sharpened several times. Large deep drilling machines are equipped with one or several replaceable plates. Large deep hole drills can also be extended. Deep drills are available from diameters of just 0.8mm up to 1,800mm.

Where are deep hole drilling machines used?

Deep hole drilling machines and tools are used for special machine construction. The requirement of deep holes is usually needed for the production of hydraulic tubes in machines. Control blocks for hydraulically operated machines are, for example, made out of massive metal blocks with precise holes. A deep drilling machine is used by machine manufacturers themselves or contract manufacturers. Further uses of a hole drilling machine are for the production of hollow shafts and specialised bar material.

Die Sinking Erosion Machines aka EDM Machine

There are two basic variants of the EDM process based on the type of electrode used which is basically the cutting tool: Die sinking EDM and Wire cut EDM. A pre-shaped or formed electrode usually made from graphite or copper, which is machined in the exact opposite shape as the one required in the workpiece is used as the tool in the die sinking EDM process and it is fed vertically down. Whereas in the case of wire cut EDM, a continuously traveling vertical wire electrode which has the diameter of a small needle or less than that is used to cut a narrow slot through the workpiece to produce the desired shape.

Die Sinking Erosion Machines Types

The basic elements of a die sinker EDM machine are: electrode, dielectric medium and work piece with auxiliary units like power supply and CNC control which are indispensable for the process to take place.

  • Electrode – It is the actual tool for removing the material. The most commonly used electrode materials are graphite, brass and other copper alloys, pure tungsten and tungsten alloys and copper graphite. Because of the inherent properties of graphite-like the high melting point above 3000°C, low heat conductivity, easy machinability and also since it is inexpensive, graphite is the most preferred electrode material.
  • Workpiece – Electrically conductive material in which the required profile is to be cut.
  • Dielectric Unit – Hydrocarbons oils are used as dielectric fluids between the electrode and the job in the vertical EDM machines. The dielectric fluid acts as an insulator until a required amount of voltage is applied after which it ionizes, producing a controlled spark which vaporizes and erodes the metal from the workpiece. The heat of each spark ranges from 15,000° to 21,000° Fahrenheit and sparking occurs in a frequency range from 2,000 to 500,000 sparks per second. The dielectric also acts as a pressurized cooling fluid which cools the vaporized metal and flushes the eroded materials off the gap. The dielectric fluid passes through a filter to remove suspended particles so that it can be reused.

Auxiliary Units Of Die Sinker Edm Machine

  • Power Supply – A pre-determined voltage is generated by a DC or AC servo system between the wire electrode and the workpiece for maintaining the spark. The tool is made the negatively charged electrode while the part to be cut is made the anode.
  • Computer Numerical Control – The CNC control is accountable for the accurate movement of the tool over the workpiece to be machined. Other features include technology to aid in the prevention of wire breaks, background editing and graphic display of programs while the machine is under operation. With a single CNC program fed into the system, several thousands of identical parts can be machined with less operator assistance. The control also monitors the offset of the tool.

Advantages And Disadvantages Of Die Sinker EDM

The most important advantage of sinker EDM process is that it can machine anything which is electrically conductive irrespective of the other mechanical properties of the metal such as hardness, ductility etc. Therefore, it is considered to be the most suitable method for fabricating hardened steels. On the negative side, it is the major limitation as well. It is not suitable for machining non-conductive materials such as plastics. The secondary advantage of ram EDM process when compared to conventional machining is that it does not set any limits on the depth of the surface that can be machined. There are no notable mechanical stresses acting on the tool or the workpiece in the EDM process unlike the other machining processes like milling, turning, grinding etc. In the latter processes, the deeper the shape, the larger cutter diameter must be selected because of the cutting force and vibrations caused by the rotating movement. One more advantage of sinker EDM machine is its capability to produce three-dimensional parts (3D) while only two-dimensional geometries (2D) can be produced by wire EDM process. The finished jobs of EDM process are burr free and with excellent surface finish thus eliminating the need for subsequent finishing or secondary operations.

When compared to the wire EDM process which employs a wire to erode the material instead of a form machined electrode, die sinking process is slightly disadvantageous in the sense that there occurs wearing of the tool. But with certain combinations of electrode and workpiece materials and by adjusting certain process parameters there is a possibility to achieve a condition called as ‘no-wear machining’. Also, it involves extra cost and time for the development of electrodes used in the die sinking process which is not the case in wire EDM. Generally in both the EDM variants, the material removal rate is very low and the power consumption is too quite high.

Planer Milling Machines

Planer type mills are the largest milling machines. Their general appearance and construction are those of a large planer but the difference is that milling is performed instead of planing. One or more milling heads are substituted for the single-point cutting tools used on planers, and the motion of the work past the tool is a feed rate motion rather than a cutting speed motion. The worktable and bed of the machine are heavy and relatively low to the ground, and the milling heads are supported by a bridge structure that spans across the table. These heavy duty milling machines, called Plano-miller, look like planing machine where the single point tools are replaced by one or a number of milling heads; generally used for machining a number of longitudinal flat surfaces simultaneously, viz., lathe beds, table and bed of planning machine etc. Planer machines are similar to bed type machines but are equipped with several cutters and heads to mill various surfaces.

Milling Machine and Planer

It is often desired that the operations of milling and planing can be combined together so that one machine capable of performing both the operations can be used which saves a lot of factory space, money and time. Thus, milling attachments were made for the planer in a single machine, and attached to the cross-rail. The changes required from the planer drive, are an extra belt to rotate the cutter, and a special countershaft to slow down the move merit of the table. This attachment can carry a slabbing, gang, or formed cutter on an arbour for horizontal milling; or it can carry end mills, by turning the attached head through 90 degrees, thus bringing the spindle to a vertical position. This last arrangement of the spindle is of great utility, as it allows cutters to reach down into places which would be inaccessible by any other means.

Planer Milling Machines and its Applications

Some of the industrial applications where planer type milling machines play an important role are:

  • It is widely used in industries for precise shaping of metals & various solid materials.
  • These machines are ideal for various processes such as slot cutting, routing, welding & turning in metallurgical industries.
  • The machine is intended for milling of housing and basic components made of ferrous and non-ferrous metals and of some selected plastics.

Bed Type Milling Machine - CNC Bed Mills

Bed milling machines are highly efficient through their particular method of operation. The production of components with complex structures (e.g. cylinder blocks or gear wheels), as well as simple milling processes, are possible on a milling machine. A milling machine uses various tools to form an entire workpiece. Automatic CNC milling machines are equipped with a tool changer. The position and type of tool is stored into the milling programme. The milling process occurs in two stages for high-end final products. “Stripping”, or “roughing”, is used to reduce excess material down to a few millimetres. Stripping is a very rough process, which can be undertaken quickly and does not require much precision. Roughing is used to mill the workpiece down to the exact desired dimensions. This two part milling process is particularly important for hard materials, which have high requirements for dimensional accuracy. Workpieces that are commonly processed using this two part technique are technical components made out of metal. Wood products are usually processed in a single step.

Bed Type Milling Machine – A Mill Machine with High Precision

 

Most milling machines are a gantry design. This includes a milling head, which moves along all axes, and is guided via a portal over the workpiece. Portal Milling Machines quickly reach their limit when dealing with particularly hard work materials, which additionally requires high precision for the final product. In order to reach this high level of precision, the milling head on a bed type milling machine is attached to a column. This column is particularly stable. The milling head can move up and down, and forwards and backwards. The sideways movements are undertaken by the machine bed, which is how the machine got its name. The rotating milling head can mill bevels and chamfers into the workpiece. Bed milling machines can only increase their levels of precision through integrating a Tool Room Milling Machines. Here the workpiece is fixed onto the work table, which moves along the x and y axis. The movement along the z axis is only done by the milling head.

Gantry Milling Machines

Gantry milling machine is one of the type of milling machine in which the milling head rides over two rails. These rails usually lie on either side of the work piece. This type of machine is usually designed for heavy, large-part machining. The gantry milling machines have ultra-heavy roller guide ways for precision, and can be equipped with additional headstocks to have five-face machining capabilities. Some of the advanced gantry mills, like CNC gantry mill or 5 axis gantry mill, utilize a twin-driven feed system on the X axis, as well as a unique backlash elimination mechanism for machining accuracy. These milling machines which operate at very high speeds can handle soft materials like plastics, aluminium etc. and they are also used in handling harder materials effectively. Equipped with linear motors on all axes, they display a high dynamics that boosts productivity. These machine are equipped with measuring systems on all axes as well.
