Types of Steel Storage Containers

Storage containers are available in a large range of sizes and types, including large storage containers, small storage containers, portable storage containers and  containers. The smallest containers can be as small as only a few meters squared. The largest containers are the voluminous shipping containers. As there are many types of teel containers, to search used shipping containers for sale are an intelligent option or simply used storage containers choosing a specific container. Industrial storage containers are used for general cargo, bulk cargo, liquids, gases and gas containers. Ideally, packaging and steel containers are usually designed to fit one another. This guarantees an efficient use of space.

Open-front storage containers

Open-front storage containers are the smallest standardized containers, which are consistently used. The are made out of folded and welded steel sheets, deep-drawn or cast aluminium, or injection-moulded polystyrene. They are used for safely storing small products like screws, springs, clasps and clips. They are mainly implemented in manual workshops, where delicate products are assembled. Open-front storage containers are open at the top and skewed towards the front. They have a slip-in window at the back for a label. The material of the container is slightly folded around the bottom. This means that open-front storage containers of the same size can be easily stacked. These types of containers are always very light; they can be carried by hand. Mechanical lifting devices are not needed for open-front storage containers. They are usually moved between a material container and the workplace. They are permanently open which means that they are not suited for the long-term storage of products, they would quickly be contaminated. If open-front storage containers are used for the permanent storage of small goods, then it is recommended to use a sealed bag for protection. This is easy to clean and effectively prevents dirt or contaminants from reaching small components.

Freight Containers - Shipper Container

Freight containers differentiate themselves from open-front storage containers, in that they have a continuous edge. They are designed to be used for the intermediary storage of materials and are well suited for bulk materials. Freight containers can be made out of plastic, sheet metal or wood. They have two handles, which makes them easy to transport. They can be heavily loaded, if additional aids like carts or hand trucks are available. A crane or machine jack can be used to lift the freight container from the cart onto the work table. Suitable slings need to be implemented when transporting the freight containers to great heights or over long distances.

Transport crates and transport boxes

These containers are bigger than stackable containers. Transport crates can also be locked. Both types of containers are very stably built and are made out of high-end material, just like stacking containers and open-front storage bins. Transporting crates and boxes are rarely made out of plastic. Thick-walled aluminium is usually used for light containers. Cheaper, but heavier and more robust variations are made out of welded steel. The containers need to be additionally palletized, if they are going to be stored for a long period of time.

Transport Steel Containers

Even though, strictly speaking, transport or shipping boxes and crates can also be containers, the term is usually used for the type of container that is transported with forklifts. This includes steel containers, or metal storage containers, and pallet cages. Plastic storage containers and stacking boxes generally have the identical dimensions of a pallet and are 500-600 mm tall. They are restricted in their height, in order to prevent overloading and to ensure that loading and unloading them is always easy. They are made completely out of corrugated steel, which means that they cannot be easily damage. These damages could have otherwise occurred from external shocks or from the goods slipping around inside. They have four welded corners on the top. These corners all have eyelets, through which a crane hook can be attached. These corners are designed so that the plastic storage containers can be stacked using a forklift or crane. The feet of a plastic storage container is specially designed to fit the pallet's dimensions. Thereby, they can be stored into the corresponding, stably-built pallet shelves. Plastic storage containers are the most stable type of storage container and can host loads of up to 1,500kg. They are suited to carry bulky materials and usually do not have a lid. If required, these are available within the industry. This is also usually necessary due to the types of products that are stored. Bulk materials like sand, granules, grit or salt are typically stored in large plastic storage containers. Metal goods like screws, fittings and unimportant machine components can also be stored in plastic storage containers. Dirt on the surface of these products is usually no problem, which is why it is fine if they are stored in a container with no lid.

Pallet cages are the second most commonly used stackable, large, bulk storage containers in industry. They are designed like plastic storage containers, in that their dimensions fit that of a pallet. They are around twice as high as plastic storage container. They are made out of four long, vertical and continuous steel angles, to which coarsely meshed grates (the side walls) are attached. The floor of a pallet cage is made out of wooden slats. Just like plastic storage containers, they have a wider angle welded onto the upper side of each foot. This means that they can be stacked onto a forklift or crane, just like the plastic storage containers. One side of the cages can fold down to ease the process of removing goods from the cage. Pallet cages are usually used for light and bulky items. The side panels are usually closed off with a cardboard or wood panel to order to ensure that these goods can be transported and stored safely. Pallet cages are suited for carrying large, bulky bags. They provide sufficient lateral support can reliably hold the required material.

Looking for used plastic containers for sale could be difficult but pallet cages and plastic storage containers for sale are generally very easy to repair. As long as the feet aren't broken or too badly bent, damages can be repaired with a professional agent. It is completely possible to weld the side walls, or grates, of plastic storage containers and pallet cages. They usually weigh around 100kg on their own and so they can either be moved manually or by using a pallet truck.

Buying used vehicles for indoor operations

Vehicles used indoors usually have specific tasks. They are constructed differently than the common automobiles and lorries found on roads. These vehicles are much more robust and have a longer working life. They are usually manufactured in relatively small batches in comparison to automobiles and lorries. Thereby, their reparation costs are much higher. Damage that occurs outside the regular wear and tear can lead to completely damaging a used forklift, digger or wheel loader. Instead of an odometer, these vehicles usually have an operating hours meter. Before entering into the used vehicles sale process, it is recommended to test all its functions especially when you are going for vehicle auctions. There are information portals available that can tell a buyer what kind of damages should be expected after a certain number of hours of operation. If the maintenance documentation has been taken care of, then this is a very useful tool to determine whether a used vehicle will still function. If this document is not available, then there should be a strong reduction in the price.

In addition to valid certification and the ability to operate for sufficiently long periods of time, some checks can give preliminary indication as to what the condition of the car is. When first looking at used vehicles for sale, it is important to note the general condition. Numerous dents and rusty components are not necessarily a reason to not buy it, but one should definitely negotiate on the price. The windows, particularly the windscreen, should have no scratches or cracks. If the vehicle does not originate from a European mass manufacturer, then it will be very expensive to replace components.

Finally, it is important to look at the front wheels. It is possible to examine their profile when turned completely to the left or right. If it is worn down on one side or on the inside, then the track is no longer safe. To fix this could cost alone about a hundred euros. Additionally, the adjustment needs to be examined. If the rod ends or shock absorbers are damaged, then it could lead to another several hundred euros.

A heavily oiled engine only means one thing: hands off. A completely clean engine means: careful, freshly cleaned! It is possible that something could be covered up. With a cold engine, open the brake fluid reservoir and start the engine, with the clutch disengaged. If there is a loud knocking noise, then the engine is ruined. Usually it is not worth it for the buyer to repair this. If gas bubbles up in the brake fluid reservoir, then the cylinder head gasket is broken. This does not necessarily write off the vehicle, but it would significantly reduce the selling price. It can be a thousand euros or more, and it could be triple that with a with a BMW or other specific type of vehicle. A defective motor can also be identified if the coolant is oily or there is a constant blue or white smoke emitting from the exhaust. There are numerous tips available on the internet for how one could undertake a thorough inspection of a used car.

Small and mid-sized vehicles for sale

Small vehicles are used in operation for short distances. This means that they are often started with a cold engine, the gears are often switched and that the brakes are used a lot. Therefore, this means that the brakes, clutch and engine are often worn down. Additionally, if they are often driven through the city they also have a risk of having a damaged body. Buying and repairing vehicles among this list of vehicles is relatively affordable. They do not cost a lot if bought new. Representative vehicles

Contrary to the stop-and-go type of small vehicles, representative vehicles are used to travel longer distances. They can be run for a long time without any problems, even when often driving at full throttle. A tell tale sign that this has been a case is through small stone chippings at the front of the vehicle. If the paint at the front of a representative vehicle has small chips, then the vehicle has been travelling at high speeds. Definition of a pallet rack

Pallet racks were conceptualised for the efficient loading via the use of industrial trucks and cranes. Pallet racks get their name from their use: heavy duty pallet racks are so well built that they can host enormous pallets, crates, steel storage containers or other containers with the standard dimensions of a pallet.

The characteristics of a pallet racking system 

A pallet rack's construction has two specific characteristics. It is generally more stable than any other conventional shelving unit. Pallet shelves are general heavy-duty shelves can carry loads of up to several tonnes per square meter.

The second characteristical feature is that these units usually do not have shelf floors. Pallets, crates and steel containers are placed on specific points: the corners. Therefore, the floor is not necessary, and not having it reduces the cost of the pallet shelf. A side effect is that these loads need to be stored in the exact right position. This means that loading a pallet rack is very safe and it optimally uses all the available place. They are particularly suited for automatic loading.

The structure of a pallet rack

Pallet racks are only made out of a few components. The stand on very stable feet, and are usually anchored to the floor or wall with steel dowels. The length of a system corresponds to its height. Some systems can be expanded. The feet are connected underneath by straight and diagonal connectors. The diagonal ones give the pallet rack the necessary stability at its base. The individual shelves are made out of powerful crossbeams. These are attached to the feet with a simple push-fit system. There is also the option of attaching the cross beams and feet via screws, brackets or other components. This achieves the highest level of security. Further diagonal supports are used to give the shelf stability along its longitudinal axis. If they are correctly installed, a heavy duty pallet racking can provide a solid and reliable service for over a decade. 

Pallet rack systems are rarely coated. The most important crossbeams are usually only galvanised. This reduces the costs and means that potential damages are much more visible.

Types of industrial pallet racks

The standard pallet rack system is the simplest construction. They are most suited for small to mid-sized storage in normal, manual facilities. Assembly, recycling and the storing of raw materials, auxiliary materials and operating supplies can increase the efficiency and safety of a normal production facility.

Automatic high bay storage solutions

Dispatching facilities and companies with high productivity rates can increase their in-house logistics by using high bay storage units. The loading and unloading processes are sped up through use of automatic systems that ensure that the loading is always absolutely correct. In addition to self-driven units of independently operating loading systems, automatic high bay storage units also require a sophisticated sensor system for the shelves and the pallets. Nowadays, the RFID-Chips are used, which are a contact-free, optical and independent system. These use radio waves and do not require any light barriers or laser scanners. Optimal space utilisation is always achieved by using an intelligent, automatic pallet rack.

Mobile pallet rack

Mobile pallet racks are used, when a lot of material need to be stored in a minimal amount of space. The entire shelf units can be moved, which reduces the space required for tunnels or passages to a minimum. Mobile pallet racks always move apart directly where they are approached. Intelligent electric systems and powerful engines mean that mobile pallet racks are highly automated. The safety aspects of this type of shelving unit should taken into consideration. The unauthorised and unsupervised entering of storage warehouses needs to be prevented. When buying an used pallet racking, it is important to make sure that there are enough emergency stop buttons available.

Channel storage systems

Channel storage systems have a single integrated loading and unloading system. They have extremely large storage capacities for all important applications. Cold storage facilities are a common area of application for channel storage systems. A channel storage system is the ideal solution for in-house logistics in terms of efficiently cooling a workspace, which would otherwise be very expensive. Just like all other automatic pallet racks, the loading and unloading of a channel storage system happens independently.

Pallet flow racking systems

A pallet flow racking system uses the First in-First out principle. It is particularly suited for storing perishable products. A pallet flow racking system effectively prevents products in the last rows from being forgotten, where they would eventually expire. It is mostly used for storing foodstuffs, pharmaceutical products and important mechanical components like spare parts for aeroplanes. Modern pallet flow racking systems work without a separate electric engine, and therefore they do not require so much maintenance and are energy efficient.

Maintaining and rearing a pallet rack

Even though pallet storage racks are very robust, they can always be worn down to a certain extent. Therefore, regularly monitoring a pallet rack is very useful. It is important that the rotational accuracy of automatic high bay storage solutions is checked by an independent monitoring organisation, in order to ensure operational security. Tasks like tightening screws, can be undertaken in-house. The most suited tool for this is a torque wrench. A high rack forklift with an operator's seat is the ideal machine for safely reaching the screws. This is even more important when getting an used pallet rack as the security features should be totally checked up.

Pallet rack accessories

Forklifts are accessories for pallet racks.

The use of accessories can significantly increase the efficiency of an industrial pallet racking. For example, shelves that can be pulled out to ease the loading, unloading and storing of bulky goods. Grates are a cheap way to ensure that materials don't fall down if the shelves are badly loaded. Impact protection against damage is particularly useful in facilities that have a lot of forklift activity. The feet of a storage unit for heavy-duty components is particularly vulnerable. Knocks, bumps or tears can easily impact the whole construction, and in the worst cases, lead to the shelf system collapsing. Impact protection around the shelving's floor bolts can effectively prevent this from happening. Push-through guards prevent a product from accidentally being pushed out off the shelf. If, for example, one accidentally tries to store a pallet on a shelf that is already occupied by other pallets, a push-through guard will prevent these other goods from falling off the shelf. Rear wall covers are used to make it look as if the pallet rack system has a wall. This can be set up behind the pallet racking system, making it look like there is an entirely different workspace. The rear wall also protects the shelves from noise and dirt. To acquire an used pallet rack could be a very good alternative.

One of the most important accessories for a conventional pallet rack is a forklift. Only electric or gas forklifts be used in indoor facilities so a good equipment is essential. Diesel-powered forklifts can also be used in outdoor facilities. Very high shelving units require a special high rack forklift, which has a particularly high lifting mast. Practice is very important in order to be able to operate these machines reliably and safely even so used pallet racks can be used for it.

The structure of a carousel

Carousels have mobile shelves. These shelves are connected to various chains, which are powered by an electric motor, that move the shelves horizontally or vertically. With exception of the input and output areas, these machines are completely covered. The input point is where the shelves are loaded.

How does a carousel work

Vertical carousels have an electronic control system. The terminal delivers the desired product either from an inputted bar code, a search system or an article number. Then the shelves move, fully automatically, up until the shelf containing the required product reaches the operator. The product can then be taken easily.

The characteristics of a carousel

The main advantage of a carousel is how quickly it can deliver the required product to the operator. Carousels eliminate the need to laboriously look through static shelving units. The delivery of goods is additionally sped up through use of a distance-time system. This determines the shortest distance between the product and the operator. With particularly large carousels, this can significantly reduce the time required.

Carousels are machines for saving space. They can be very efficiently loaded. Unlike static shelves, carousels eliminate empty space. Carousels are very ergonomic. All products can be stored and taken from a very comfortable height. Bending over and stretching to reach for products is no longer necessary. Stairs and ladders are also no longer required. Carousels can be programmed with the “First in-first out (FIFO) accumulator”. First in-First out is particularly important for all perishable products. Carousels provide a good quality assurance for the food and pharmaceutical industries.

Carousels are completely enclosed and have additional safety features, which means that they are very safe to operate. Injuries from carousels can only happen intentionally or from highly negligent misuse. A limited access control system can be implemented to ensure that only authorised workers have access to certain shelves.

Use of a carousel can significantly reduce the need for industrial trucks. The “goods to man” principle also eliminates the need for lift trucks.

However, the “goods to man” principle can also be one of the disadvantages of carousels. Only one person can use the shelving system at a time. This can be a problem during peak times, when queues can cause interruptions to work flows. This problem can be solved by using several shelving units. However, this is a limited solution. Another disadvantage is that carousels have relatively high installation costs and require disciplined operators. They can easily be about 100 times more expensive than installing a regular shelving unit. However, these costs can also be calculated against the space saved by having this type of shelving unit.

Loading a carousel for the first time is a very demanding process, because every product needs to fit into a defined storage space. The discipline during the continuous use of a carousel is the deciding factor of how efficient and durable the machine will be. If goods are continuously being removed without confirmationthen the carousel will quickly loose its efficiency. In most situations this problem can be avoided through use of an efficient goods management system. If all products are equipped witha RFID-Chip, then the carousel can automatically log all changes to the goods stored. With all the right accessories, a carousel is a very valuable component for a modern goods management system.

Sizes and types of carousels

There are two types of carousels. Carousels that operate horizontally are called “carousel racks”, whereas carousels that operate vertically are often called “paternosters”. There is thus a wide range of designs available based on the two basic principles of the vertical paternosters and horizontal carousel storage units. The carrying capacity of a single shelf can be several hundred kilograms. Mid-sized, heavy and bulky goods can be just as well stored in vertical carousels as small and light goods. The industry has a range of different solutions. Nowadays, storage systems that can carry a thousand kilogrammes per shelf and 60 tonnes per system can be easily produced.

Working with a carousel

As was already mentioned, the disciplined logging of what products have been taken out and put into the carousel is the central deciding factor on how efficient the system will be in the longterm. There are several systems in place for informally loading a vertical carousel storage system. Depending on the complexity of the goods management system that is place, it is important to have special training when first loading the carousel.

Vertical carousels often collect a lot of dust and dirt. It is very important to regularly clean the shelves and components for health and safety, and hygiene reasons. Assistants, service providers or contract workers can be hired for this job. All vertical carousels have a function, which allowed the shelves (with exception of those that are locked) to be manually controlled. Before cleaning the shelves, assistants need to be trained on how to place the goods back onto the shelves.

The technical maintenance of a carousel vertical should only be undertaken by specially trained personnel. Reparation services should not be undertaken ad hoc, even if the machine breaks down, is defective or jams. The safety system of a vertical carousel is only suited for normal operations. If these safety systems are bypassed, then the carousel vertical could pose a significant risk to the life of workers.

Buying Used Vertical Carousels

There is currently a revolution happening in the field of vertical storage systems. Many companies are now replacing their long-used paternosters with lift systems. These are faster, more robust, simpler to maintain and more energy efficient than the old paternoster system. The main advantage of a lift system is that only one shelf moves at a time. When taking things in and out of a paternoster, the whole shelving system has to move. Most investment programmes include getting rid of these used vertical carousel storage systems. Paternosters are now out of date, which means they are available very cheaply on the used market. Most of these machines, which are from the 1980s, are no longer useful machines because they cannot be adjusted to fit modern management systems. However, they are still well suited to replace existing storage capacities.

Suppliers of carousels

Special systems for drums and coils are available from the companies VDIR, GIOVANELLI and VIDMAR. The companies DEXION, EWS and ITB provide horizontal carousels.

It goes without saying that there are many different kinds of static and mobile shelving systems; however, getting the right fit is half the battle. Modern shelving systems vary greatly in size, shape, materials and fitment.

The Differences in Shelving Systems

The differences between shelving systems are fundamental. Pantry shelving systems for the kitchen, which are simple wooden shelving systems intended to support the weight of food, are going to be completely incompatible with van shelving systems, which need to be riveted in to an often slanted metal structure, and regardless of what cross-constructed jobs have been conducted, the fact remains that finding the right mobile or wall shelving systems does not have a single definitive solution.

The availability and range of storage shelving systems stretches far and wide, and the uses of such structures can be just as varied. Industrial shelving systems will need to be stronger, larger and more durable than standard wood shelving systems found in the home. Any industrial supply company will be able to provide a system that can be readily installed straight off the shelf, or for a higher premium, a more bespoke and fully tailored approach can be had. In today's automated world, adjustable shelving systems are the norm in many business environments, and it doesn't just stop at basics such as roller racking. An adjustable shelving system can incorporate just about any small or large business need, with entire systems that can accommodate a workforce walking around inside it, or the availability to be stacked onto a truck 'as is' and replaced with an empty, identical counterpart.

For smaller businesses who cannot afford a five or even six figure price tag, smaller commercial shelving systems are still an option. Companies such as Bruynzeel and Invicta, both market leaders in their field, can provide very competitively priced metal shelving systems to fit around budgets and more modest criteria, whilst still providing durability and ergonomic satisfaction.

For the home user, many will be familiar with the modular shelving system model; a system that appears to be made of stacked boxes, and on many occasions is just that; however, this design is now available from just about any home furniture specialist; DIY stores have a wealth of modular shelving systems in their ranges, and for a surprisingly low price. In a home DIY setting, garage shelving systems, complete with fixing kits, can be purchased easily and without much relative expense. The difference between a small home shelving kit and more robust steel shelving systems is that they are intended to be riveted to a primarily stone surface, and will be more long lasting in what is inevitably going to be a damper and wetter environment than the average lounge or bedroom. If a fully fledged steel shelving system sounds like overkill, more modestly priced wire shelving systems can still rise to the task and withstand grim weather conditions whilst ensuring that your items stay where you want them to stay.

Who Manufactures Shelving  Systems?

There are many different companies who provide shelving systems. What is a Walking Excavator?

Walking excavators also known as spider excavators are construction machines that move forwards on four wheels, which are connected to the undercarriage by legs. These legs can also be used to adjust the track width and the height of the vehicle over a wide range of dimensions, ensuring that the machines remain highly flexible and can be adapted to the surrounding conditions, both in drive mode and work mode, when the stabilizers on the legs are extended. This means that they are ideally suited for working in locations such as very steep slopes or streams. Walking dragline excavators are intended for excavating large volumes of soils. The specific ground pressure while working with a walking excavator is pretty small which permits the use of walking draglines on excavating soils with low bearing capacity.

Walking Excavators and its Parts

The major elements which make up a walking dragline are: support base, rotating platform, superstructure, working equipment, electrical equipment and walking mechanism. The base which is just a round steel plate is used for supporting the other components and to transmit the load to the soil.

A few applications of walking excavators in the industrial environment are listed below:

  • Hydraulic engineering
  • Stripping operations in the mining of coal
  • Mining of rock products
  • Construction of large feeder canals for irrigation systems
  • Forest harvesting

There is also a huge potential to exploit the usage of walking excavators for other applications by employing different kinds of attachments depending upon the requirements.

The History of the Plough

The plough is thought to have been invented sometime around 6,000 BC in Mesopotamia and the Indus Valley, when man first began to harness the power of animals. The Egyptians and Romans made further modifications to the basic concept but it wasn't until the 17th century when major improvements were made. The last half century has seen some major leaps forward in plough technology, including hydraulic turnover systems, furrow width adjustment, technologically advanced frame designs, shear bolts and auto-reset systems; assets which need to be taken into consideration when looking for plows for sale and choosing the most suitable used plows for your requirements.

Types of Plough

The introduction of the mouldboard plow or frame plough was significant in that it cut down on the amount of time needed to prepare a field. The mouldboard section of the plough is instrumental in inverting the slice of topsoil cut by the ploughshare and laying it in the furrow at about a forty five degree angle. Reversible ploughs have two mouldboards mounted back to back, one right turning and the other left turning. While one is in use the other can be suspended, and the pair are turned over at the end of the row. 4 furrow ploughs are reversible ploughs capable of working a larger area of soil at one pass, thereby vastly increasing efficiency. It was the coming of mechanisation that made the use of multiple furrow ploughs such as the 4 furrow plough possible, as they require more power to drag through the soil. The chisel plow is used to attain deep tillage while causing relatively little soil disruption. This implement, unlike a moldboard plow, does not turn or invert the soil, thereby helping to prevent soil erosion and allowing a layer of organic matter and crop residue to remain on the surface. This has led to the chisel plow being regarded as a boon to sustainable agriculture practices. The disc plow has a number of individually mounted concave discs arranged into two or four sections. These are slightly offset to maximise their effectiveness, so that they loosen and pick up the soil that is cut. This implement is particularly useful in hard and dry soils or in scrubby or rocky land, and are sometimes known as harrow ploughs. If you are looking for a tractor plough the most crucial implement to consider is a disc plough, as initial cultivation can be extremely difficult without the proper equipment.

INDUSTRY

ELECTRONICS
INDUSTRY- AN OVERVIEW

Electronics industry is the business of creating, designing,
producing, and selling devices such as radios, televisions, stereos,
computers, semiconductors, transistors, and integrated circuits. The
electronics industry transformed factories, offices, and homes,
emerging as a key economic sector that rivalled the chemical, steel,
and automobile industries in size. Important sectors that have made
great advances include laser and optical electronics, digital
electronics, and microwave electronics. Advances in the field of
electronics have also played a key role in the development of space
technology and satellite communications; inaugurated a revolution in
the computer industry that led to the introduction of the personal
computer; resulted in the introduction of computer-guided robots in
factories; produced systems for storing and transmitting data
electronically; greatly expanded the market for popular music and
culture; and, in the process, transformed life at home, the office,
and the factory. Many of these innovations, such as the transistor,
had their origins in military research, which needed increasingly
complex electronic devices for modern high-tech warfare. The
electronics scope also encompasses embedded electronics in transport
(cars, planes, trains, etc.), in defence equipment, in IT
infrastructures as well as electronics used in manufacturing process
or professional services in order to boost productivity.

ORIGIN
OF ELECTRONIC INDUSTRY

The industry traces its origins to the invention of the two-element
electron tube (1904) by John Ambrose Flemming, and the three-element
tube (1906) by Lee De Forest. These inventions led to the development
of commercial radio in the 1920s. In 1947, the electronics industry
made another important advance when John Bardeen, Walter Brattain,
and William Shockley invented the transistor. Smaller, lighter, and
more durable than the vacuum tubes that had been used in radios,
transistors touched off a period of progressive miniaturization of
electronic devices. Integrated circuits, which were developed in the
1950s, allowed the integration of several circuits into one circuit,
and the introduction of analog devices in the 1960s vastly increased
the amount of information that could be stored on a single silicon
chip.

In the 1960s, the U.S. consumer electronics industry went into
decline as manufacturers were unable to compete with the quality and
pricing of foreign products, especially the electronic goods produced
by Japanese companies such as Sony and Hitachi. By the 1980s,
however, U.S. manufacturers became the world leaders in semiconductor
development and assembly. In the 1990s semiconductors were essential
components of personal computers and most other electronic items
(including cellular telephones, televisions, medical equipment, and
"smart" appliances). While U.S. companies are still a major
presence in the semiconductor industry (representing about 40% of
world sales in 1998), the consumer items themselves are mostly made
overseas. Worldwide electronic sales were nearly $700 billion in
1997. As new societal markets with tremendous market potential will
develop, electronics contribution to the global wealth creation will
grow further. It is therefore a strategic industry, which should
benefit from at least part of the massive recovery plans put in place
in 2009 by major economies worldwide.

ELECTRONICS
INDUSTRY VALUE CHAIN

The electronics industry represented 1140 billion Euros in 2008 and
is today comparable in size to other important industrial branches
such as the Car industry (1800 billion Euros in 2008). A rather
impressive figure for such a recent industry whose origins go back
only half a century Growth cycles and electronics pervasion are the
roots of such a rapid development. First driven by government
applications in the 60s and 70s, enterprises in the 80s and finally
individuals since the 90s, the electronics industry is re-inventing
itself since its origin thanks to massive R&D investment, which
translates into permanent new product introduction. Today, new
societal needs in energy, security or health are relying on
electronic solutions that are still to be developed, providing
long-term growth perspectives for the overall industry for the next
decades. Although the electronics industry demonstrates more mature
growth profiles, it is still a young industry with major growth
perspectives ahead.

PRODUCTS
FROM ELECTRONIC INDUSTRY

CAPITAL GOODS

Capital goods include such products as electric motors, electronic
control equipment, switchgear, and power supply lines. It is
primarily a capital goods that manufactures goods which are used by
other companies for their production.

INTERMEDIATE
GOODS

Electronic
components, which include semiconductors, count as intermediate
goods. Intermediate goods are also used in the manufacture of goods.
However, in contrast to capital goods, they are integrated into these
goods. The demand for these two categories of goods comes from
industrial companies. The general economic environment determines the
level of activity in the electronic industry: in an upswing phase
firms produce more and have above-average demand for intermediate
goods and capital goods.

CONSUMER
GOODS

The
third category of goods is consumer goods. Here, the product spectrum
includes such goods as televisions, washing machines and light
fittings and electric lamps. Key factors for these goods are above
all private consumption and demographics. As the population declines,
the potential for consumption declines.

The structure of a belt grinder

The basic construction of a belt grinder is a wide grinding belt, which is fixed between two rollers. One of the two rollers is powered, and the other roller creates the tension needed to prevent the grinding belt from slipping. The belt can be replaced, if all tension is released. Belt grinders with a particularly narrow grinding belt are called a band file. Hand-held belt grinding machines are equipped with a handle and a knob, in order to ensure a two-handed operation. They are either available with a power cable, or are battery-operated. All established manufacturers of power tools have a range of belt grinders in their product range.

Stationary belt grinders guide the workpiece over the grinding point. This can be very advantageous, depending on the design and type of work. This method can process small and light workpieces more precisely, than if they were clamped in and processed using a hand-held belt grinder. They are made out of a table with an attached belt grinder. Alternatively, the table grinder is tightly screwed onto the work top.

Particularly large types of belt grinders are the so-called long belt grinders. These are used to process workpieces with large surfaces. Grinding machines are used for de-rusting, deburring and preparingheavy metal components so that they can be further processed. These stationary machines are only used in specific industries, and are hardly available as used machines.

Working with a belt grinder

Belt grinders are used for wood, plastic and metalworking. The quality of the grinding results depends on the limitations of the machine and the grinding tool. Therefore, it is important to check the material and the graininess of the grinding belt, to see if they fit the task. Belt grinders have a high torque, which is why very course belts remove a high amount of material. Belt grinders are preferably used to process solid materials. Removing old layers of colour, milling deburred or burnt metal pieces, or roughening metal or plastic panels are some of the most common uses of a belt grinder.

Industrial Compressors Applications

There are large indirect and direct risks associated with industrial compressors. Electrical shocks or fires caused by faulty insulation are a common occurrence when using this energy form. The development of power is also very limited. Hydraulic energy is the standard form of energy used for large and precise power generation. The hydraulic pump is usually electrically powered. Hydraulic operation is good for high amounts of power, but this means that the processing speed is low. Therefore, pneumatic power is the preferred method for processing and reforming small components. The disadvantage of pneumatic power is the high level of primary losses that occurs due to the compressibility of the air. This is the most expensive form of energy used for operation. However, it is still the most useful type of energy supply in industrial and manual work. It is a very efficient form of energy, particularly due to the high speeds that work stations can reach via pneumatic energy. The compressed air needed for pneumatic applications is supplemented by electrically operated compressors.

Structure of a Compressor

Compressors have the same principle construction despite their different designs and sizes. An industrial compressor is made out of a compressed-air generating unit and an accumulator. Depending on their size, feet, rollers and boxes, compressors are usually mounted on a trailer. The compressed air generating unit – the actual compressor – is powered by an electric motor. The pressure is taken in by the compressor using a pipe. Pressure can be released, stored or monitored via a faucet. A pressure gauge is available to display how much pressure is available in the container. The accumulator is made out of a welded steel plate.

There are two principle constructions available for the compressor device. The most common design is the reciprocating compressor. Similarly to a four-stroke engine, this type of compressor consists of a crankshaft, connecting rod, cylinder and vents. The air is sucked in during one stroke, compressed and then transferred to the accumulator.

The second design has two screws that run into one another. When these are running, the space between the screws becomes smaller, which compresses the air even further. Screw compressors have a lot of advantages in relation to reciprocating compressors. The old technology of reciprocating compressors is gradually being replaced.

All the advantages of a screw compressor are due to the differences in their construction. The screws that run into one another are the only part of the device that moves. Additionally, they can run contact-free, which reduces their wear and tear, energy demand and noise levels. Reciprocating air compressors are characterised by being very loud, which means that it is usually necessary to install these machines in a separate room. The numerous jerky components of a reciprocating compressor usually have a high level of wear and tear. Therefore, maintenance is usually very demanding and should not be neglected.

Compressors have an internal compressed air sensor, which controls the engine. If the maximum amount of pressure is reached in the tank, then the air compressor will switch off automatically. If the boost pressure is reached then the compressor switches on again and builds up the pressure. Pressure gauges and compressed air sensors are two components, which are regularly checked by independent monitoring organisations. If either of these components are broken, then the tank can overload and burst. This has damaging consequences. Compressors are often installed outdoors for safety and noise reasons.

Applications for Air Compressors

Compressors produce compressed air. They are used in small workshops for painting and blasting work and are used as a direct carrier for the applied substances. The air is the ideal carrier, which controls and hosts materials to be sprayed. Compressed air is used to clean components very well. Even hard to reach areas can be accessed and very well cleaned using the corresponding guns. A compressed air pipe with an attached gun is usually found in the close proximity to a cutting machine (e.g. milling machines). Before working with this so-called air brush, the worker should be sufficiently briefed. Compressed air guns can cause great injuries, and even death, especially if used jokingly around bodily orifices. In addition to powering paint and blasting guns, compressed air is also used in workshops to power hand tools. Pneumatically operated welding, drilling and assembly tools are characterised as being particularly robust, not weighting much and having greater resilience in relation to electric tools. The main use of air compressors in an industry is to create compressed air for various pneumatically operated production machines. Pneumatically operated machines are a particularly safe option, when electric energy is not available. The main advantage of pneumatically operated processes are that they have high clock rates, they are consistently precise, and they are easy to install and operate.

Compressors are very easy to operate. They are ready for operation as soon as they are connected to electricity. If there is no electricity available, combined electricity and compressed air generators can be used. These are usually implemented on construction sites. In the construction sector, compressors are generally used to power caulking hammers. They are most commonly used for large machines. Jack hammers can often be used where caulking hammers are not suitable. It is particularly important to note that the accumulator does not get damaged. Blows from a hammer, knocking into the machine or components, or falls can turn the compressor for sale into a bomb. This occurs when the stored energy, in the form of pressure, is suddenly released. This has a very high risk of damage and injury. Generally, industrial air compressors for sale are very reliable and safe machines that can be economically and efficiently operated.

Rotary Screw Air Compressor

The rotary screw compressor is intended for larger scale use where large volumes of air are needed, such as in the powering of high energy tools, like jackhammers, or simply in large industrial applications using a lot of equipment. Unlike piston compressors, there is no "pulsation" with an air screw compressor, providing a continuous flow.

Working of a Screw Air Compressor

Screw air compressor generally use two helical screws, or rotors, to compress the air. This can be achieved in two ways. An oil free screw compressor uses timing gears to ensure the screws are precisely aligned. On the other hand, an oil injected screw compressor uses the screw compressor oil to fill the spaces between the screws, providing a hydraulic seal as well as lubrication. Typically, a dry screw compressor will have a lower maximum pressure rating than an oil screw compressor. The compressed gas is then forced in one direction where, in the case of an oil injected screw compressor, it is separated from the screw compressor oil.

Single Screw Compressor

The rotary screw air compressor is not limited to a two screw design. The single screw compressor, using a solitary screw and two gaterotors to achieve the necessary compression, has the advantage of being able to be fit into a smaller form factor. This form of rotary screw compressor is largely used in cooling and refrigeration.

Compressors are work absorbing devices which are used for increasing pressure of fluid at the expense or work done on fluid. A reciprocating compressor commonly referred to as a piston air compressor is a positive displacement machine in which the compressing and displacing element is a piston having a reciprocating motion within a cylinder. Reciprocating compressors are capable of giving large pressure ratios but the mass handling capacity is limited or small. Reciprocating piston compressors may also be single acting compressor or double acting compressor.  Single acting compressor has one delivery stroke per revolution while in double acting there are two delivery strokes per revolution of the crank shaft.

Construction and Working of Piston Compressor

The principal parts of a reciprocating piston compressor are: piston, cylinder, inlet valve, exit valve, connecting rod, crank, piston pin, crank pin and crank shaft. Inlet valve and exit valves used are of reed or plate type, which are either floating or clamped. Usually, backstops are provided to limit the valve displacement and may be of spring loaded type which get opened and closed due to pressure differential across them. The piston speed is decided by the valve type. When the compressor piston moves from the top to the bottom, suction pressure is created causing opening of inlet valve. With this opening of inlet valve and suction pressure the atmospheric air enters the cylinder. Air gets into cylinder during this stroke and is subsequently compressed in next stroke with both inlet valve and exit valve closed. This is the reason why both inlet and exit valves are of plate type and spring loaded so as to operate automatically as and when sufficient pressure difference is available to cause deflection in spring of the valve plates to open them. When the piston reaches the bottom, it reverses its motion and compresses the air inducted in previous stroke. if you are in need of an air compressor for sale or a used piston compressor all these factors must come in consideration. knowing how a machine works makes buying more easy. 

Compression is continued till the pressure of air inside becomes sufficient to cause deflection in exit valve. At this moment when exit valve plate gets lifted the exhaust of compressed air takes place and the piston gets back to the top position. Suction, compression and discharge are the three prominent processes getting completed in two strokes of piston or one revolution of crank shaft in the reciprocating compressor discussed here.

Application

Piston compressors are invariably used for all applications requiring high pressure air and they are one of the most widely used compressors for construction machinery. Some of the popular applications of piston air compressors are for driving pneumatic tools and air operated equipments, spray painting, compressed air engine, supercharging surface cleaning, refrigeration and air conditioning, chemical industry etc.

The Basics of SnowBlowers

One of the most interesting facts about these machines is that they are often used interchangeably with the term "snow thrower". In fact, this is incorrect. A snow thrower uses one process to remove the snow while a snowblower is involved with a two-stage process. There are numerous types of snow blowers available and one of the most common is a design which enables the user to walk behind; much in the same way that a lawn mower is used. So, let us take a more in-depth look at how these units operate alongside some other key metrics as a garden machinery

As mentioned previously, the most important part of a snow blower is the blade (or horizontal auger) assembly. There are many different types of snowblowers such as residential units and industrial machines capable of removing tonnes of snow in a matter of minutes. The one major difference is that larger models can be powered by gas turbines or jet engines for extra "throwing" power. All will contain controls which are behind the main assembly. For the protection of the user, there may also be an emergency stop switch in the event that a foreign object becomes caught within the blade mechanism. A protective shield will surround the blades. This heightens levels of safety while allowing the operator to better see where he or she is clearing.

How Dose a Snow Blower Function?

The basic principle behind the majority of snow blowers currently on the market is the same. A set of angled augers will rapidly spin and capture the surface snow. In turn, the snow will be displaced from its original position. Thus, the user has much more flexibility when clearing a path. Many designs will also have a chute which is attached to the auger. This allows for greater directional control when moving the snow out of the way. In more robust commercial snowblowers, a two-stage process can be employed. This consists of a second auger mechanism built within the chute. Such a method will further granulate the material before it is blown out. For those who live in environments that receive a substantial amount of snow each year, this design is generally preferred. In more detail and as mentioned previously, the motor can be powered by a standard electrical supply or it can use diesel fuel (as opposed to petrol) for its operation. Using a rotating mechanism in the snow blower, a blade (in the shape of a paddle) rotates outward and picks up snow during this motion. In some snowblowers on sale, this blade is fastened directly to the engine while in other designs is it connected through a system of belts and pulleys. Either way, the action is the same. The snow is removed and displaced a few feet or more from the path which is intended to be cleared.

Where is a Snowblower Used?

Obviously, snowblower is used within environments that can expect to receive regular snow during the winter and which are subject to a high level of foot traffic. It is still important to note that different riding snow blowers are intended to be used within specific conditions. The electric snowblowers are considered to be less powerful than the gas snow blowers or their diesel counterparts. Snow that is generally not deeper than four inches (ten centimeters) can be handled by these units. Diesel-powered blowers are able to accommodate much deeper snow. A snowblower is equipped to handle snow which is light and fluffy. Should it be compacted, extremely wet or is layered with ice, the auger mechanism may not be able to break through the material and send it down the chute. Also, there are chances of the chute itself becoming clogged. Most manufacturers will specify the conditions for each blower for sale and it is therefore best to speak with a professional to select the ideal option.

What are the Main Safety Issues when Looking at Used Snow blower Sale Items?

It should be obvious that the most important safety issue revolves around the augers and blades involved in the extraction process. These can be quite dangerous and there have been some instances of personal injuries. This is particularly the case if the auger becomes jammed with snow. Should a user not deactivate the machine and attempt to clear this snow by hand, the mechanism could reengage and cause potentially grievous bodily harm. However, there are several innovations which mitigate the chances of this occurring. Most modern used snowblowers  such as the popular ARIENS snow blowers contain a device known as a "dead man's switch". This will immediately deactivate the unit when the controls are not physically engaged (such as a toggle or hand-operated lever). Secondly, when looking for blowers for sale, make sure these machines will also have a plastic tool that can be used to safely clear any clogs without risking damage to one's hands or to the machine.

Major Snow Blower Manufacturers

Like many machines, there are indeed no two snowblowers which are made alike. It is always best to choose the top brands in the industry. Not only will this help to guarantee the safety of the snow blower, but it is also likely that a warranty will be included in terms of parts, labour or a breakdown. Some of the best snow blowers used these days come from manufacturers such as ARIENS,YAMAHA, WESTA, CRAFTSMAN, LOFTNESS snowblowers for sale  TORO, TROY-BILT and YARD Machines. Every manufacturer has its own speciality and some of the most popular manufacturers can answer on most of your requirements such as the JOHN DEERE snowblower and HONDA snowblowers.

Used blowers - Things to Consider

Above all, it is important to mention that each of these brands is likely to supply a number of different subcategories such as electric blowers, gas snow blowers, and one- or two-stage systems (in regards to the number of augers mentioned earlier). By understanding how these snow blowers operatethe best, it is much easier to make the best choices when looking for used snow blowers for sale.

Trenchers are valuable tools mainly used for excavating trenches, ditches or other deep channels in the ground. Trenching machine models are available in a wide range of sizes and types, enabling various trenching tasks to be completed successfully.

What does a trenching machine consist of?

A trencher for sale may be either chain driven (a chain trencher), or constructed using a wheel (a wheel trencher). Both types may be purchased as a trencher attachment or as a machine in its own right. Chain driven trencher equipment consists of a large belt or digging chain which is stretched around a curved frame, usually made of metal, called a boom. This type is sometimes called a chainsaw trenchers. The boom can be altered to different angles, allowing trenches of varying sizes to be cut. When in use, the trencher chain turns on the boom as the machine moves forward, removing soil and debris to form the trench. A wheel trencher (as the name suggests), is fitted with a toothed metal wheel instead of a chain and operates by biting into the earth in incremental chunks as it proceeds.

Varying sizes available

From smaller hand held trencher or portable trencher options through to enormous wire trencher and rock trencher options, there are a number of different sizes available. As trenchers undertake tasks as diverse as quarrying and road repairs, it’s essential to select the one which is appropriate for the job in hand. The specialist nature of this plant means that there are few generic options available, which is why trenchers hire or finding an affordably priced used trencher for sale is often a good alternative to purchasing a new item. The hazardous nature of trenching means that selecting the right choice for the job is absolutely vital.

 

Specialist features of a trenching machine

Depending on the industrial sector in which the machinery is going to be used, there are a number of variations of a trenching machine  can be considered. A walk behind trencher for sale or other hand trencher, for example, is often an excellent investment for estate management, small holdings or other small scale enterprises. Landscape gardeners or park management services may benefit from the precision which a bed edger trencher or edger trencher can bring, whilst wire trenchers are a superb option when you have large amounts of perimeter fencing to lay.

Different trenchers for different soils

Obviously a rock trencher is the best tool for digging through uneven landscapes where boulders and pebbles are common. Generally wheel trenchers are more suited to environments where rocks or tree roots abound, whilst a tractor trencher provides superb tool for work in challenging, muddy conditions. Many companies opt for a skid steer trencher that enables close observation of the work whilst still keeping the operative safely elevated. Smaller enterprises frequently make use of a trenchers attachment, which can be used with a tractor or other plant when needed, then removed so that another attachment may be utilised.

 

Working with trenchers

The complex and dangerous nature of working with this type of equipment means that appropriate training is essential, particularly in an industrial environment. Luckily using smaller skid steer trenching equipment (a bobcat)is relatively straight-forward, particularly if operatives already have experience of using skid steer machines for other digging or loading tasks. A large cable trencher or one used for excavation in high risk environments requires significant amounts of training to use safely, both in terms of machine operation and also awareness of variables which may present a significant danger, such as unexpected obstacles or unstable ground.

Trenching Machine manufacturers

There are several major suppliers of trencher plant, including DITCH WITCH, DIGGA, MARAIS and the VERMEER company. There is a large second hand market for items from these suppliers, due to both the high value of the products and also their incredible durability; with the right care many of these machines will last for decades, so a used DITCH WITCH trencher, for example, could still have years of useful life in it. Whether you opt for a walk behind trencher for sale or a different model, used plant is frequently a cost-effective solution to your trenching needs.

Chainsaws - Forestry Equipment

A hand chain saw is predominantly used for cutting trees, such as when preparing firewood, processing pulp or performing tree surgery. There are two general types of chainsaw for sale: the electric chainsaw and the petrol chainsaw. Both work by harnessing their respective sources of power to rotate a chainsaw chain around a guide bar, which can come in different lengths. To aid the sawing action, the chains have cutting teeth on their outer surface of varying styles. For instance, the curled and alternating “chipper teeth” chainsaw blade is a popular choice for many due to its robustness in dirty and abrasive conditions. Chainsaw chain types can also come in a range of pitches (half the length of three rivets) and gauges (drive-link thickness), as well as tooth-spacing arrangements such as the conventional setup of one blade for every two links. The petrol chain saw uses an internal combustion engine similar to those found in cars, but with a much simpler one cylinder setup that performs a two-stroke action. Electric brands are powered by an electric motor. In both types, the power is driven by a centrifugal clutch, which allows the chain saw to stay running when not in use, and a sprocket-wheel over which the chain rotates at the base of the guide bar. Over the years, the safety of chainsaws has progressed considerably with the introduction of anti-vibration chainsaw chains, chainbrake systems and an improved overall design, reducing accidents and saving lives.

Chainsaws for Professional and Amateur Settings

Because of the range of chain saws available and the improved protective features, chainsaws can be operated safely in a number of settings by users with varying experience, whether for forest harvesting or pruning trees. For work in a garden, there are small chainsaw options as well as brands with shortened guidebars and less-powerful engines, ideal for felling small trees or clearing branches quickly. The reduced power of an electric chain saw makes it the best chainsaw for these applications. There is also a range of chainsaw parts and accessories available for extra protection including goggles, clothing and hearing protectors. In a more professional setting, cutting thick tree trunks in a forest will require a powerful engine and longer guide bar. For applications such as the limbing or felling of large trees often required for forestry work, the best chainsaw is often a petrol chainsaw model.

Chainsaw operators will also prefer certain types of chainsaw chains for particular jobs, such as low vibration options while working up trees. To suit certain jobs, there are a variety chainsaw parts you can buy to modify your machine. A pole chain saw, for instance, is an adapted model and the best chain saw for reaching otherwise inaccessible branches. For one-handed operation, the top handle chainsaw is designed for use up a tree in reaching further than you would normally be able to with two hands, similar to the pole chainsaw.

The Structure of the Chainsaw

The basic components to a chainsaw include an engine, sprocket, centrifugal clutch, guide bar, saw chain and tension adjuster, as well as a rear or upper handle. The engine will be either electric or gas chain saw powered. In a gas chain saw, the back of the machine houses the fuel tank, engine, carburettor box and spark plug. The carburettor and spark plug are vital components to the combustion process in a petrol chainsaw engine. An electric chain saw will contain an electric motor at the back of the machine and a cord leading to a power source, unless it is a cordless electric chainsaws. At the front of a chainsaw is the guide bar, which is usually made of alloy steel to protect against wear. The guide bar can come in a number of lengths ranging from 40 cm to a lengthy 90cm, depending on the type of sawing job. The saw chain rotates around the guide bar when in operation, as well as the sprocket that is housed under the chain tensioner. The purpose of the chain tensioner is to allow the user to adjust the tension in the chain so that it doesn’t come loose or bind with the chain saw. To protect from cutting yourself, best chainsaws for sale will have a rear and upper handle guard.

Lawn Scarifiers

A lawn scarifier, otherwise known as a dethatcher, is a gardening device used for removing thatch from grassed areas, thereby promoting healthy growth. Small, electric machines are available for average domestic use, and petrol engine professional models are used for larger jobs such as sports fields.

Why It's Necessary To Use A Garden Scarifier

Lawns can become gradually suffocated by a layer of grass cuttings, moss, leaves, rhizomes, lateral weed growth and other organic matter which finds its way onto the surface of the soil around the stems of the grass. This layer is known as thatch and it can restrict the penetration of the water, minerals and other nutrients that grass requires to be as healthy as possible. In time this can lead to a decline in the appearance and wellbeing of the grass. This problem can be addressed by scarifying the surface and subsurface of the grass by means of penetrating metal blades, prongs or tines which remove the built up layers of thatch. The removal of thatch encourages thicker grass growth and results in a firmer lawn that is less susceptible to disease and which allows water, air and nutrients to penetrate to the root zone. Additionally, lowering the grass scarifier and allowing it to break the soil surface will open it up and allow it to become a receptive bed for grass seed. The scarifying machine you need will depend on the nature of the job at hand. A very small area of grass can easily be scarified manually using a scarifying rake. However, this can be an exhausting job on a fair sized lawn, so this is where an electric scarifier comes in handy. A scarifier aerator will penetrate the surface of the soil, breaking up compacted areas and allowing the easier access of water, nutrients and essential microbial life. If you have a large lawn, you might wish to consider using a petrol scarifier. Professionals taking care of sports fields will prefer a scarifier that can be towed along behind  riding lawnmowers or lawn tractors.

Why Not Look For Used Lawn Scarifiers For Sale At Auction?

Such sites allow you to have a good, wide overview of scarifiers for sale, so that you can pick and choose the brand and model that's right for you. Additionally, used lawn rakes and scarifiers can be had at a fraction of the cost of buying new, meaning that you can add to your collection of garden equipment at a relatively modest outlay and keep your grass looking great all the year round.

There are two types of wagon available; the first is pulled alongside the harvester using a tractor and the second is attached to the back of a self-propelled harvester. A slitter machine cuts rolls of material into narrower sections for various industries.

A Slitting Machine

Slitting machinery is used for shearing large rolls of a particular material, in a method known as “roll slitting,” into thinner sections. The process of creating narrower rolls can be achieved by unwinding, cutting and rewinding the material - known as rewind slitting - or by simply slicing the roll as it is. The former method is completed using a slitting and rewinding machine such as a steel coil slitting machine.

The Slitter Setup

In general, a coil slitting machine will consist of an uncoiler, a slitter and a recoiler for rewinding the newly cut rolls. The type of material will determine the kind of blade and cutting technique used for the slitting and rewinding machine. Steel slitter machine solutions, for instance, use complementary cutting rolls for slicing hard materials, while razors are often used on slitter machine options that cut softer materials such as plastic.

Slitting Machine Types

A slitting machine for sale can be classed as a roll slitting machine or a coil slitting machine. The latter cuts materials in an unravelled form – also known as a slitter rewinder machine - while the former uses a powerful cutting device to slice the roll. These machines can come in all shapes and sizes; small roll slitters may be used to cut paper for receipts or lottery tickets, while larger varieties can cut harder materials such as with a metal slitting machine or a bopp tape slitting machine, which is used to slit rolls of plastic for packaging operations.

Areas of Industry

The converters industry use slitting cutter machines extensively for the manufacturing of laminate and print materials. A bopp tape slitting machine is often used by food packaging companies within this industry, slitting the material with a slitter rewinder machine or roll slitting machine.

Manufacturers to Look Out For

ALS is a well-known manufacturer of manual and automatic log slitters for cutting films and tapes. In the UK, you'll often find a slitting machine for sale from Atlas or ASHE, who both provide solutions for the conversion, paper and web industries. The Chinese firm Hangzhou produce steel coil slitting machine solutions often found at used slitting machine auctions in the low slitting machine price bands. Other manufacturers include Taiwan-based HCI Converting Equipment, SRG International, B.R.D, Caple, Uflex, Ocean Extrusions and ITL Industries.

What are centrifuges and what are they used for?

A centrifuge is a device responsible for the separation of fluids or gas. The device applies a sustained centrifugal force (centrifugal force is an inertial force and appears when an object is moving in a curved path). Each centrifuge has got a spinning vessel, which at a high speed pushes denser materials to the outside. The materials which are less dense are moved to the center. A washing machine, that pushes outside the excess of water from clothes, is also an example of a centrifuge. Centrifuge machines are commonly used in laboratories.  

What are industrial centrifuges?

As any other type of centrifuges, industrial centrifuges are used for separating gas and fluids. There are two main types of industrial centrifuges: sedimentation (separating solids from liquids, or liquid from liquid) and filtering centrifuges (passing a liquid through a filtration media). Here are a few examples of industries, where industrial centrifuges are useful: 

  • Chemical processing 
  • Food processing 
  • Mining and mineral processing 

Different types of centrifuge machines

Apart from industrial centrifuges, there are other types of these machines. 

  • Benchtop centrifuges - a benchtop centrifuge is a compact, space-saving type. It is very often used with small amount of material (i.e. yeast cells or erythrocytes). 
  • Ultracentrifuges - those devices are used at very high speeds (up to 9 800 km/s²). There are preparative and analytical ultracentrifuges. 
  • High-speed centrifuges - high-speed centrifuges are capable of generating very high acceleration while handling larger samples. 

Centrifuges can be also classified by their rotor design (fixed-angle, swinging head etc.) or by their intended applications (laboratory, analytical, gas etc.).

What is a hand pallet truck?

A hand pallet truck is an industrial truck with or without electric drive used to transport pallets and other heavy equipment on a firm, level surface. Pallet trucks are a universal and flexible means of transport, therefore they are in great demand in a wide variety of industrial sectors. They are comfortable, manoeuvrable and very easy to operate. Since they produce little noise when being pulled or pushed, they are also suitable for quiet zones.

A hand pallet truck weighs less than 100 kg, but its load capacity is up to 3 t. Some models are equipped with mobile weighing devices and ensure precise weighing. In addition, most hand pallet trucks have individually adjustable forks with different fork lengths, so you can easily adapt them to your needs.

All types of pallet trucks use integrated hydraulics to lift the load. A hydraulic cylinder actuated by a long lever handle (drawbar) enables the lift truck to be steered and lifted in relation to the rollers. The up and down movement of the drawbar drives the hydraulic pump.

Where are hand pallet trucks used?

Hand pallet trucks are the perfect solution for a variety of transport tasks that have to be carried out daily over short distances. They are characterised by their high load-bearing capacity and easy manoeuvrability in confined spaces, which is why pallet stackers are so popular as storage aids.  

Standard versions of the hand pallet trucks are mainly used in warehouses and workshops. In contrast to standard shapes, special models (such as scissor lift trucks) also allow the loading of large shelves or machines, as these can lift the transported goods to greater heights. Additional equipment such as an integrated weighing system, for example, supports work in order picking, especially in large companies.

What are reach stackers and container forklifts?

Reach stackers are industrial trucks used to transport and store cargo containers at ports and terminals in an efficient way. They offer a very flexible solution and an inexpensive alternative to costly gantry cranes and straddle carriers. Reach stackers are versatile vehicles delivering high performance and robustness. Their efficiency is determined by different factors, i.e. lifting speed, lifting load or being user-friendly.

Stacker vehicles can be found at port locations where they are used for lifting and transporting containers. These manual-operated trucks can carry cargo as heavy as 50 tons and stack several containers high. They are able to transport loads quickly over short distances and are most effective at medium-sized ports or terminals.

Stackers became an indispensable part of international freight transport. A large number of lifting operations can be carried out while stationary, which is a particular advantage when space is tight at the transshipment point.

Like reach stackers, container forklifts are handling machines used to stack containers mainly in ports around the world. They can also be used for large logistics and/or warehousing platforms. The difference between reach trucks and container trucks lies in the mast size.

The structure of a reach stacker

Reachstacker solutions have long lifting booms which can pick up containers and raise them as high as several containers. Powered by hydraulics, the boom attaches to containers using rotating twistlocks. At the base, the operator controls the vehicle in a cab.

What is a low lift pallet truck and where can I buy one?

Low pallet truck is just another name given to hand operated forklifts that work at a low lift capacity. These trucks are designed for moving a pallet back and forth between the warehouse storage and retail floor versus stacking goods. Depending on the model, they can transport boxes and pallets weighing up to 3 tonnes.

There are many variations of low lift pallet trucks and you can choose the one according to your needs, budget etc. One of the options you can select while buying the truck is a manual vs an electric powered vehicle.

Electric low lift trucks are operated with electric motors, commonly in three-phase AC technology. They are usually equipped with either a maintenance-free gel battery or a traditional lead-acid battery. The low lift pallet trucks can be simply recharged at charging stations.

Thanks to their compact size, the low lift pallet trucks take up very little space, which is particularly advantageous for companies struggling with lack of space. The pallet trucks can easily be placed under a pallet in the warehouse.

  • Length of transport distances
  • Safety and security in the workplace

What is a truck mounted forklift?

Truck mounted forklifts (also known as piggyback forklifts or truck-mounted forklifts) are industrial trucks used to move and lift goods on almost any terrain. Unlike other types of forklifts, truck mounted vehicles can be attached to a truck. They are an asset to distribution companies, since they can be attached to the back of a goods lorry, travel wherever it goes, then be quickly dismounted and used to load goods, saving companies a lot of time. Truck mounted forklifts do not longer rely on an operator to unload or load the goods to be transported.

Truck mounted forklift is a strong, yet lightweight piece of loading equipment that is attached to the back of a lorry and transported wherever the lorry goes. The forklift can safely move up to 3.5 tonnes of weight from the lorry delivery point, depending on the model. Thanks to their agile nature, they are perfect for usage in environments that are harder for bigger machines to access and navigate, such as construction sites. However, they are also useful in logistics, agriculture or recycling industries.  

What are the advantages of truck mounted forklifts?

Truck mounted forklifts are characterised by versatility and reliability. But they provide many assets:

  • Efficiency: deliver more, faster and better.
  • Elimination of manual handling: no more arduous tasks of loading and unloading goods. Protect your operators' health by avoiding these.
  • Damage reduction: while transporting your goods are exposed to damage. Reduce or even eliminate losses related to transportation and unloading.
  • Productivity: time is money, with a truck mounted forklift, there is no need to wait for staff when unloading on site. You gain in independence and save lots of time.
